Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: morinkat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites-Miami Airport/Blue Lagoon recently and loved every minute of it. They had a continental (hot) breakfast every morning. The food was excellent and changed from day to day. The front desk staff were the BEST!!!! They were very friendly and helpful. They would check on us everyday to see how our activities of the day were and made suggestions (which we loved doing) of what we should do next. Rooms were clean, open and very comfortable. Pool was nice (not huge, but comfortable). Hot tub was on the smaller size and cool, but would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “1 br suite - not recommended”
Reviews.Author: Gregg B
Reviews.Content: I had a 7 day reservation, only spent 1 night. Not clean, old, expensive for what it is. Good location. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Cassandra021397
Reviews.Content: I took a lot of time to research our hotel prior to booking our pre and post cruise accommodations, and was certainly not disappointed in the Hampton Inn - Miami Airport/Blue Lagoon. I knew even upon booking the hotel, in my dealings with Jeffrey, that this was the place to stay. The shuttle arrived quickly upon our arrival at the Miami airport, and the hotel was approximately a 5-10 minute drive away. The location is fabulous, with a Walgreens, restaurants and a shopping centre directly across the street! We were greeted immediately with a smile and checked into our room within minutes. The room was spacious and clean, and the free wi-fi was a bonus! The pool was refreshing and there is a very nice lounge area surrounding it. Very relaxing after a long flight. The breakfast was terrific and was a great start to our day. They even had flavoured creamers for the coffee:) We utilized the fitness centre, and it had something for every fitness buff! We decided to take a taxi to the Port of Miami, and Valerie booked us a larger taxi to accommodate the four of us and our luggage - It was just under $30 with tip. I cannot say enough about the friendly staff at this hotel. From the front desk to housekeeping, everyone was very friendly and went above and beyond to be accommodating. Following our cruise, we returned back to this hotel to stay another night. We arrived shortly after 10:00 a.m., but Valerie secured our luggage and we were checked into a room by 11:00 a.m. A young couple had stayed at this hotel pre-cruise as well, and returned here following the cruise to see if they could pass some time before their flight left that evening. Although they were not staying another evening, the hotel staff accommodated this couple and even secured their luggage. I had trouble printing my boarding passes for our flight the next day, and Valerie also printed these out for me on the hotel printer. She always had a smile and wanted to ensure our stay was enjoyable and relaxing. We certainly were well taken care of and had no worries! Thank you Hampton Inn & Suites - Miami Airport/Blue Lagoon! Your sincerity and hospitality did not go unnoticed! We will definitely book here again if we return to Miami, and will certainly recommend it to family and friends! Cassandra Bowden

Reviews.Title: “Hampton ease”
Reviews.Author: phillie15
Reviews.Content: Very convenient to the airport, it took me 10 minutes to turn my rental car in. Secure parking complimentary a plus as is a very nice outdoor pool area, for a Hampton. . A letdown was they did not recognize me as a HiltonHonors Gold member which is the first time that has happened after many stays with Hampton, Embassy and Doubletree hotels within the chain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Location”
Reviews.Author: MinnTravelor
Reviews.Content: Great Pre-Cruise Location Stayed there March 10th 2012 before a cruise. **Great FREE shuttle service from airport. Once we had our bags, I called the hotel to inform them I was ready for the shuttle. It arrived within 10 minutes. Quick ride to hotel from there. **Free Breakfast in the morning. Nice selection. **Great location. Located within a very short walk to: Walgreen's, CVS, Grocery Store, Liquor Store, Burger King, McDonald's, Wendyâ€™s, Star Bucks and some local restaurants. **Rooms are small, but not bad for 1 night. **Very fast cab ride from hotel to Port of Miami. $30 with tip. I would stay here again for my next cruise.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VenturaTraveler13
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on either end of a trip to South America. The shuttle service is prompt and the driver helpful. It is pretty much your typical Hampton Inn, sparked in this instance by the young, energetic staff, especially Marrianne, who did everything possible to make our outbound stay comfortable and hassle free. The property is in good shape, though showing its age. I was prepared to give it high marks on cleanliness until, on the last day, I noticed the floor under the bathroom sink was dirty with large clumps of something in the corners. To be fair, other than that, the rooms and bathrooms were very clean. The rooms are quiet which is a big plus for being so near the airport and with people coming and going all night. A good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice overnight stay before cruise on Liberty”
Reviews.Author: KarenStevens
Reviews.Content: arrived at this hotel on Friday night before cruise. Called using courtesy phone at airport and shuttle was there within 5 minutes. Check in was smooth and we went up to room. Had a kingsized bed room. We were pleased with the room and pricing of this hotel. Walked across street and ate at the Subway. Next morning stopped in at the Walgreens across street to pick up soda, suntan lotion as well as a book for cruise. Went with the shuttle service that the hotel provided to the port, $10 p/p and we had the 10 am shuttle with two other couples. Almost forgot, we had breakfast included with stay. Waffles, eggs, biscuits with gravy... were just ok. Value price wise as well as shuttle was why we chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but that's not enough to save this rundown hole”
Reviews.Author: tennesseine
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have noted, the staff at this hotel are indeed very friendly and helpful. But that isn't enough to save this sorry property. I stayed here overnight before flying out of MIA and I was very disappointed. My demands for an airport hotel are always reasonable, since I know that airport hotels are almost always the worst. I just want a clean room, a good place to work out, fast internet connection to get my work done, and perhaps a decent TV on which to rent a movie if I've time. That's a pretty low bar to set. And yet, this property failed across the board: 1) Internet connection was close to dial-up speed. 2) Workout room was an absolute DISGRACE. The weights machines were ancient and in poor condition. No free-weights/dumbbells at all. One single treadmill. An embarrassment all 'round. 3) TV wasn't working properly. I called down to ask and they said the 'system ha[d] been down for a while'. (?!) This was really unacceptable quality for a Hilton property. It's the second time in the last two months I have had problems at a Hilton hotel. Their management should rouse themselves from their apathy and start taking notice of the deterioration of their properties before Hilton becomes the American Airlines of hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is alive and well at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tim H
Reviews.Content: The customer service provided by the staff at this hotel was unbelievable, especially Valerie Rubert. She went above and beyond the expectations of our group, she was always cheerful and smiling and always extremely helpful. Valerie made our stay at the hotel an incredible experience, making suggestions on when we should go to the airport to pick up another guest, who flew into the Miami airport, as well as to the departure time to go to the cruise ship, so that we would miss the rush to board the boat. Valerie should be commended for her desire to provide the excellent customer service to the hotels guest. You can tell that Valerie loves her job by her attitude to serve the customer, this is a quality that you do not see very often and she should be rewarded for this!!! I would definetly recommend this hotel to friends and family to stay here when they are in town. Keep up the excellent work. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Convenience + excellent welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: AthensBulldawg
Reviews.Content: Tripadvisor reviews were correct about the quality and convenience of this property. To save on airfare, we flew into Ft. Lauderdale prior to our cruise from the port in Miami. The transfer to this Hampton Inn & Suites was easily arranged (shared ride from FTLL @$21/person). Our hotel reservation, with the requested room on a top floor away from the elevator, was handled correctly and we were greeted warmly by the staff at the desk. The room was clean and well appointed; the bath was large and comfortable. The breakfast buffet was typical for Hampton Inn and plenty for us - the seating area was large and included an area just outside near the pool. Tip: At the time of check-in, go ahead and arrange for the cruise ship transfer in the morning. This assures you can choose your preferred time (we left at 10 am for early boarding, elite members). On a Saturday morning, for a group in a bus towing a luggage van, this was one of the smoothest transfers, with speedy stops at each ship in turn. Excellent and efficient driver. When sailing from the port in Miami, I anticipate we will return to this nice property. Try it.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: JamaicaJoleen
Reviews.Content: Clean, safe, locked parking. Love the Hampton Inn and Suites. Very comfortable and great front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great customerservice after all!”
Reviews.Author: lelici49
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review about this hotel based on our experiences during a flood they had: http://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g34438-d224248-r119353259-Hampton_Inn_Suites_Miami_Airport_Blue_Lagoon-Miami_Florida.html This week i was contacted by their manager, who was truly sorry how things worked out for us in september 2011, and compensated us for the inconvenience we experienced caused by a guest who thought a sprinkler was a cloth hanger. Of course i accepted his apologies, and thought this was a classy act of a man who is proud of managing a very nice hotel in the Miami Airport area. In our case, well i guess we were at the wrong place at the wrong time in september 2011. Since management like this is hard to find, we will visit this hotel again next year, and i'me sure everything will be fine! PS: I thought it was only fair to correct my former posting; everybody makes mistakes, but correcting your mistakes is what makes you stand out from your competition!! BRAVO, MR. RIOFRIO!!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Miami hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandy C
Reviews.Content: We travel to Miami quite frequently to visit our daughter who is a student at University of Miami. This is the first time we have stayed at this hotel, but definately our choice of hotels when we come back to Miami. The staff was warm and welcoming. Especially Jeffrey, the manager, who knew us by name and would stop to chat with us. The beds were very comfortable and we got a great nights sleep. The shower was amazing - plenty of water pressure and plenty of hot water. The pool and hot tub area was clean and well taken care of. And it is open all night long so we were able to enjoy the hot tub even if we got back to the hotel late after a long day out. Location was perfect - convenient to the airport, as well as UM. We will be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Miami!!”
Reviews.Author: Monica F
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property twice - once in 12/2011 and again in 2/12 - both times were wonderful and both times were overnight before a cruise. There is a free shuttle from Miami International Airport - we only waited about 15 minutes for the shuttle. When we arrived at the hotel, the staff was wonderful. The first time, we were early and they stored our bags and recommended some food options. Giardino's across the street was great - large portions, reasonable prices, GREAT food! When we got back, our room was ready. The pool and hot tub were great both times. Breakfast the next morning had many choices, including some hot choices - eggs, bacon, waffles, oatmeal. A real bonus for the stay to have breakfast included. We signed up when we checked in to get the early shuttle to the Port of Miami - I think it was $10.00 each - very reasonable. You get dropped off right by your building to get on the ships. When I went back in 2/12, they remembered me!! Alex was expecially helpful :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton Property Ever.”
Reviews.Author: micah03
Reviews.Content: I travel all over north America and I gotta say this is by far the best Hilton Property I have ever stayed at. It matters very little to me whether or not my room is fancy or if there is a beautiful pool or lounge area(which this place has) but what really matters is service. I hope that the entire Hilton organization sees how Alexandra and Kristen view customer service and adopt it worldwide. I work in the field of Repuation Management and I have consulted automotive industry professionals how valuable your Repuation is and how important customer service is in every customer interaction,I will be using Alexandra and Kristen as examples of who to emulate. Thank you, A Proud Diamond Member

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: RAB394
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night prior to an early AM flight. For the price, I was expecting a much nicer hotel. The carpet in the room was very old appearing and in bad need of a replace. We had to call for sheets for the pullout, even though I made it clear at check-in that we would be needing to use the pull out. The maid who brought us the sheets told me she couldn't speak any english when I asked her to bring 2 pillows for the extra bed, as there were none in the room. (I got my point across in broken spanish and hand signals, and she did bring back pillows.) If I had realized the overall quality of this hotel in advance, I would have gladly paid up an extra $50 to stay in a much nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected”
Reviews.Author: david g
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the hampton, because of the free parking and internet service...the location is excellent too. Tonight when I checked in something new is happening, the managers reception. Wow the chicken salad was amazing, the wine was excellent, and I topped it off with a slice of carrot cake. Yum! No need to leave the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “convenient and close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: kim661
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs upgrading (carpets, bathrooms, etc.). However, the personnel were extremely nice. The breakfast was good for a hotel chain. Room was comfortable and quiet to be so closed to the Miami airport.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for much more.”
Reviews.Author: HaveVisaWillTravel
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, love the comfy beds. It was pricey but such is Miami. Not sure this would be amongst the "best buys" but it was nice. Pretty good breakfast which had a good variety of things and changed daily slightly. Everyone was very friendly. Gym was relatively small but better than most. Room was nice and elevators use card security sweep. Not a big deal but if you are concerned about security. Parking was free in their lot and there was always room when I was there. Quite a few smaller restaurants in the area. I recommend Patagonia on 7th. Nothing remotely bad to say other than it seemed pricey to me but it might have been just the timing also.

Reviews.Title: “None better in this part of town”
Reviews.Author: mushroom24
Reviews.Content: I stay in Miami three or four times a year on business near the airport. I have stayed here for the past eight years.I come back for the friendly service and a familiar home away from home after all this time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: SummerLuvr50
Reviews.Content: The staff, especially Daysi, were just wonderful. Our flight arrived early in the morning and although check-in is not until 3 p.m., we were able to get our rooms at noon. Daysi arranged for a cab to pick us up and take us to Bayside and told us if there was anything we needed while we were gone, to give her a call. Our room was very nice and quiet. We were leaving for a cruise the next day and Daysi arranged for shuttle service for us. For only $10 a person, it's well worth the price. If I ever take a cruise from Miami again, I will definitely stay at this Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Very Expensive, not in a great part of town”
Reviews.Author: peamomma
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Miami Airport on our way back from our Key West vacation. It is outrageously priced for a Hampton Inn (thank goodness for Hilton Honors points). It is not in a great part of town, evidenced by the gates surrounding the parking and you need to use your room key to use the elevator. You do get free internet and free breakfast with the room price. The breakfast was better quality than a typical Hampton Inn (though it didn't make up for the room rate). Unless you are wedded to Hampton Inns, shop around for another airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding pre-party get together!”
Reviews.Author: SheridanGreymare
Reviews.Content: We absolutely enjoyed our stay..we were upgraded which worked out beautifully as we were parents of the groom to be..the entire staff was wonderful and the suite was great...I would stay there again anytime!! The hotel & grounds were very nice...

Reviews.Title: “Book Blue/Lagoon Hapmton Only if you want Excellent service, a good breakfast, clean rooms,& smiles”
Reviews.Author: cruiseagain
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent, needed the best for the price for a Wedding aboard a ship in Miami. Total of 36 people ( all family and friends from Out of town) not one complaint,only positive feedback. PU at airport is complimentary and arrangements made with hotel for car service to Miami Port for the early wedding went smoothly. The managers party on Friday night is a "plus" . Kudos to Ivy front desk and Flor for making things go smoothly. Need a group, a must to speak to is Christina who oversees it all. She is the best and needs to be acknowledged with a 10 Plus for all her help. She made me a star with my clients. thank you and will Absolutely book your Hampton again. Marcia@cruiseagain.com

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for flying”
Reviews.Author: ronzam
Reviews.Content: Great for flying from or into MIA and wanting to stay the night near the airport. Reliable shuttle runs every 30 minutes. Decent free breakfast, and yummy free cookies at the desk in the evening. Try booking through hotels.com for a much better rate if you're willing to go non-refundable, and if you're flying in or out, your trip will pretty much be locked in anyway. Prices drop about $40 per night. Also good for stay, park and fly. We've done this twice in the past year, and are doing it again in June.

Reviews.Title: “Everybody's Got a Cousin in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: jrdavis05
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on the night of January 28, 2012 while we were in town for the Jimmy Buffett show at the American Airlines Arena. There are plenty of other hotels that are closer to the arena, and for the most part, all of those hotels are either run down, or cost a fortune. If you only care about distance, this hotel is not for you. However, if you are like my wife and I, and want to stay at a quality hotel for a decent price, or if you want to be close to the airport, then this hotel is for you. At the time I booked this room, this hotel was rated by Tripadvisor as the #9 hotel in Miami! It is rated that high for a reason, this was an excellent hotel. We arrived promptly at 3pm (check in time), and I was greeted by two wonderful girls that were working the front desk. Both were very friendly and professional. They were both very engaging, asking the reason for our trip. When I advised that we were going to a concert, they informed me of another concert, the "Chili Cook-off" that was in the area the next night. Being in Miami, which is a very cosmopolitan city with a large Hispanic population, both girls spoke both English and Spanish (I heard them on the phones with customers when I first came in the lobby). This is very helpful for any travelers which prefer to communicate in Spanish. My special room requests (High floor) were granted. The facility has both a 1st and 2nd floor parking area, each of which are accessed via room key, with a full security gate (I will get to the need for this shortly). The room was very clean. The only downside was no refrigerator, but the ice machine was close by. Comfortable bed, quiet, was able to get a good nights sleep. Bathroom was nothing special, just a typical hotel bathroom, however it too was very clean and there were enough towels. There was also a very nice, large flat screen television in the room. If you need it, a desk and chair, with free wi-fi. The hotel is not in the best area, although there is a McDonalds, Walgreens, and a Chevron gas station in walking distance. I would not hesitate to walk around the area myself, however I would not want my wife or children (if I had any) walking in the area alone. Most people that stay at this hotel probably do it as a convenient point for heading over to the cruise port or if you catch a late/early plane flight. All in all, this was an excellent hotel, and if we were in the area again, I would likely stay here. Believe the high ratings this hotel gets! It gets them for a reason!

Reviews.Title: “Miami Airport Hampton Inn Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MArk H
Reviews.Content: Very Clean which is hard to find in this part of Miami ( by the airport), overy accomaditng staff staff. the free Breakfast was above the standard free "continental" offerings you usually have

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was a godsend in the middle of the night!”
Reviews.Author: philisa h
Reviews.Content: What a godsend this hotel and staff were to me and my husband late at night. We arrived Miami after an 11 pm flight and went to a nightmare hotel a family member had booked for us. We immediately began looking for another hotel and called the Hampton. Front desk person, Isreal, took us right away, gave us a great room and was very helpful that night. He made sure we were taken care of. The room was great! Very clean hotel, room, breakfast area. Very nice staff (front desk staff-Isreal, Valerie, mgr Victoria, breakfast staff). We highly recommend this hotel! We will definitely book again when visiting Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jim1942
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here after a delayed flight from heathrow, and the staff could not have been more helpfull.They arranged a shuttle to the cruise port for next day, and it went like clockwork.Nice room with good beds and vary nice bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stopover...”
Reviews.Author: Flaherty99
Reviews.Content: We walked out of the airport terminal as the shuttle came by so that was a great start. The hotel is about a 6/7 minute drive. We heard no airplanes during our stay. Staff were efficient and friendly. The common areas of the hotel seem newer than the rooms. Bed was comfortable and the room was quiet enough, although if you have a room over the road that runs past the hotel then you do hear the occasional car/horn. Wifi was bullet fast - excellent and free. The room itself was ok, bed was very comfortable. As a stopover this hotel makes a lot of sense - as other reviewers have pointed out you're very near to restaurants and shops. Breakfast was free and fine - cereals, toasts, pastries etc. My only gripe is that with the exchange rate our room was very nearly Â£150 for the night - I think this is slightly expensive for what is essentially a one night hotel. That said - it's good and I will stay here again in February on another stopover.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes this hotel great!”
Reviews.Author: edgewater5
Reviews.Content: A Hampton Inn is a Hampton Inn, and we selected this hotel as we were going on a cruise and wanted and a cheap easy launch and return point. The hotel is literally minutes from the Airport with a free shuttle that got us back and forth to our transfer to the ship. On our return stay we found it easy get around with our rental car as the hotel is near the highway and about 10 min from downtown. Amenities - the rooms are basic, nothing fancy. In fact if I had one down point on this review it would be the fact that the cleaning staff could do a bit better. There was dust on the ceiling and we found a stuffed animal in our open out bed - but hey if the couch is closed I can see how it was missed - the hotel took care of things right away once I let them know. The pool was nice, the breakfast was awesome, but let me save the best for last - the staff. They were truly AWESOME, helpful and friendly. Daysi is wonderful and would be hard to compare, but every other staff member I interacted with was great too. I highly recommend this as a home base for a family looking to go on a cruise and then spend a few extra days afterward.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: morampkc
Reviews.Content: The staff was by far the most friendly that we have experienced at a hotel in a very long time. The hotel overall was VERY clean and modern. The hot breakfast buffet was very nice and during the week the complimentary horderves and wine was an unexpected bonus. If there was any negative points it would be that the pool area needed a bit more attention. The pool deck was in need of a power wash and the hot tub was way too hot, the unheated pool way too cold. Also the proximity to the road made it a less than ideal place to relax. I would like to add that there is several major fast food restaurants, pharmacys, and a grocery store within walking distance. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service and Relaxing Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: CGSanDiego
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the staff and hotel. I had to extend my stay and they were very accomodating. The room is quite, clean and comfortable. I was on the side of the airport and street and was worred about the noise. That was not even an issue. Every single person on the staff is super friendly and ready to help in any way they can. Whether it's directions, some place to eat or you just need a stamp, they are well prepared to help you out. Thanks for making my trip pleasurable.

Reviews.Title: “Back a Second Time...Still Great!”
Reviews.Author: canuckgal33
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at this hotel and it was just as great the second time. Close to the airport (free shuttle to and from the airport) that runs every 30 minutes or so. It's in a great location with pharmacies, grocery stores and places to eat all within walking distance. The rooms are wonderful. They are spacious (this time we had a little suite) with a pull out couch (surprisingly very comfortable) and a king size bed. Pillows were nice. Everything was very clean. The breakfast area was busy, but there were a lot of tables and chairs. They had the usual cold items (muffins, pastries, a varied selection of cereal) and some good hot items (eggs, potatoes and bacon or sausage). Super helpful staff, always very friendly and willing to answer any questions. I would definitely stay here again...it's a wonderful hotel for a good price in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sn0w_sucks
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night before our cruise and this was a great choice, thanks to the other readers comments! We arrived before check-in and since we getting away from snow they kindly held our bags so we could go out and relax by the pool! Room was clean and comfortable, they gave us a small goodie bag as a thank you for waiting for our room. I didn't expect it as it wasn't even check-in time! There was a great little mall across the street with a Publix for a few coolers and snacks. We ate at a Chinese restaurant in the mall and it was very good, portions were very large and cost was very reasonable. They had a fantastic breakfast which stayed open later than the posted time to accomodate the full hotel of guests. The shuttle from the airport we found to be very prompt and helpful. We took a taxi to the cruise terminal although they can arrange a shuttle. With 4 of us and a mountain of luggage we needed a larger taxi and the cost was under $25 to the port of Miami. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Fitzie77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night on an overnight layover. The staff was all very professional and friendly, the room was clean, and comfortable, and updated recently enough that it is pleasing. The free wi-fi is a big plus, convenience to the airport, and complimentary shuttle service make it a great choice. I ate at the little Anacapri Italian Restaurant located in a strip-mall across the street, and enjoyed it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teeoff1
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure to sleep there on an overnight stay with friends before our cruise. The welcome was great and the facilities were excellent. Close to the airport and port of Miami was a plus for us to choose this Hilton's familily member and the price was just right. The shuttle was on time and service was very courteous and the fare to the port was $10.00 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Spoilt by awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: HerNibbs08
Reviews.Content: The suite was great, the staff friendly and helpful and the shuttle service was very good but the breakfast was awful. Polystyrene cups and plates with plastic utensils. Cheese omelettes that were cold, tasted like powdered eggs and cheese which was nothing like cheese. Served in a tureen en masse. Accompanied by turkey sausages and cold homes fries. That was the hot offering. Inedible! If this is the breakfast offering at The Hampton Inns we will not be staying at any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: luthgicap
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel late November after flying into MIA. The hotel has good,clean rooms which were also vey spacious. Breakfast was reasonable but who can complain when its supplied free! Unfortunately the hotel pool was closed for renovation during our stay but it did look rather small. Free shuttle to the Airport was a bonus too, if only the drivers could have smiled a little.........

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: kellymarie05
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I drove from Northwest Ohio, to Miami for a cruise leaving out on December 31st. We drove non-stop (only stopping for potty breaks). We were advised to get a hotel out of Miami, to avoid high costs of hotels. When we arrived in Fort Lauderdale at 9am in the morning after a 22 hour drive, we checked the Trip Advisor app for a good hotel, we decided to stop at a Holiday Inn. I went in, and they said that including the standard cost of $130, we'd have to pay for an additional half a day since we wanted to check in before the standard check in. I wasn't down for that, so I went back out to my car, to see if we could get a better deal elsewhere. I looked up Miami hotels, and since I've had good experience with Hampton Inn, I decided to check out the reviews for the Miami Hampton Inn, Blue Lagoon. Called them right away and spoke with Kristen, I told her I was desperate for a place to rest my head, and that we had drove for so long. She told me to come on down, and that we could check in right away for the price of about $125. I mentioned to her I had read a review that said a customer had kept her car there (for FREE!) instead of driving it to the cruise port and paying $20 a day to do so. She put me on hold, came back and said I could also have the same thing, so immediately I knew we had to haul our butts to their hotel. Kristen was there to greet us, and had us checked in right away. Our room was 509, not too shabby of a room, our toilet clogged once (no biggie) and the hallway kind of smelled, but that was a MINOR MINOR problem, considering how much the Hampton Inn pulled through for us. Instead of driving our car to the hectic Miami cruise port and leaving it there for 7 days, which would have meant we would have spent $140 just to do that, we kept our car in the secured and gated bottom floor of the Hampton Inn garage for free. When we returned our car was safe and sound. We ended up paying about $145 for the room, and had free breakfast which is always a plus. The Hampton Inn at the Blue Lagoon, Kristen and the rest of the staff saved us big time. I will sing their praises indefinitely.

Reviews.Title: “Happy short stay in Miami at this Hampton Inn & Suites”
Reviews.Author: SwissAirTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed only 1 night at this Hampton Inn and Suites in December, after a long trip from Europe and before travelling around Florida. Our stay was nice, no complains apart from the noisy A/C system in the room. Bed was comfy, bathroom was big enough for 2 (but not very clean on the floor), free wifi, free parking and free breakfast. All what we needed for a quick stop. Room on 8th floor. Hotel is near the airport and not far too from Miami Beach by car (15-20 minutes drive). In the aera, you'll find Walgreens store, CVS, Wendy's and many other shop. We might comeback next time if price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great for short stops”
Reviews.Author: Canadians_who_travel
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here on our way to a cruise out of Fort Lauderdale. We got a good flight to Miami and Fort Lauderdale Everglades cruise port is about a 40 minutes drive. It is conveniently located near the airport and a small strip mall. the strip mall has a few good restaurants and a Publix grocery store. It does not seem to be the best of neighbourhoods although we did feel safe walking as a group (adults and children) between our hotel and the mall to go get supper. The hotel front desk was super friendly and courteous (hats of to Alexandra and Valerie!!). Unfortunately, the rooms need some renovation. They appear to be relatively clean but age has caught up. The mattresses should also be updated. We were also quite disappointed to have no hot water the morning we got up to leave. It wasn't even very early in the day (approx. 8:00 am). The front desk simply apologized saying they had a problem. Not much comfort when, as a traveller using a hotel, all you simply want is a good night sleep, a shower and some breakfast. The breakfast area was busy, well stocked and relatively clean. It was very busy, I guess they did have a hard time keeping up with the cleaning of tables. The choices were the standard (awful hot choices to our taste; however, great cold healthy choices) for this type of hotel. Unlike manyHampton Inns we've stayed at, we were disappointed to learn there was no happy hour. This hotel does feature a wonderful patio adjacent to breakfast area. The patio also holds the swimming pool area, a nice touch! We used the fitness centre in the morning. They should add at least two other treadmills. There was a line waiting to use the only one available.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for business , but not extraordinary service”
Reviews.Author: marianobasso1973
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel for business porpouse, good breakfast , the gym it is very small and the laundry machines can be improved. if you get a suite , you have a supermarket very near so it is fine, but if you go to a normal room and you arrive later than 6 it is complicate find a good restaurant in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: MarkWindsorOntario
Reviews.Content: Service was great. The room was okay for a one night stop over. Nothing spectacular. Nice breakfast. Very good chinese food across the street in the plaza.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT STOP-OVER HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: allanhovi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hampton Inn Blue Lagoon recently as an overnight stop enroute to Bermuda. The hotel was well located close to a variety of eating places (including an excellent Cuban restaurant - Casa Juan) in close proximity. The front desk staff were professional and helpful and the Hampton's facilities were typical of the other Hampton's we've stayed at. The only negative comment was that there were several families with a large number of kids staying on the same floor as we were. The parents seemed to be perfectly contented to have their kids race up and down the halls until well after midnight. When I tried to call the front desk twice to ask them to deal with the problem, the front desk did not answer their phone. Either no one was on duty or those who were ignoring their phones. Not good....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice, shuttle service disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LeitaLuetta
Reviews.Content: We are avid Hampton Inn fans and the hotel was great, as always. Their shuttle service is poor. Rather than a large hotel shuttle bus, they have a panel-truck van. When the drivier circles the airport, if the van is full of passengers and/or luggage, he drives on by which left us to call the hotel again -- two times. We were left standing for over 30 minutes. The hotel does not have easy access to the airport so allow extra time to commute. We won't stay there again because of the airport access.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been cleaner”
Reviews.Author: Erica d
Reviews.Content: I had a non-smoking room with a King bed for three nights from Nov 11th-14th 2011. Although the room was adequate in terms of size the bathroom wasnâ€™t very clean. We also asked for a room with a fridge and microwave and didnâ€™t receive it. The bed was very comfy and the sheets were white and clean but the bathroom wasnâ€™t very clean and the carpet needed to be vaccumed.. Breakfast was the same every morning; breakfast potatoes, assorted pastries or muffins, bagels, toast, waffles if you wanted to make them yourself with the waffle maker, tea, coffee, cereals, fruit and scrambled eggs or eggs with ham. Although they have an adequate selection of food the food wasnâ€™t well made. It lacked a lot of flavours and taste. The potatoes were hard every morning, the eggs were also over cooked and tasted horrible and the bagel that I had was stale and inedible. I began to skip the hot breakfast foods and stuck to whatever the staff didnâ€™t have to actually make themselves. The breakfast area and lounge was rather nice and inviting and I liked that they had coffee and tea out the entire night, although the coffee and hot water wasnâ€™t actually kept hot. The staff members at the front desk were very kind and helpful; they let us check in earlier than the allotted time. There were also a lot of ice machines and the main lobby was rather clean. The airport shuttle and free parking was a nice bonus and I really liked that the hotel had very good security. The parking was monitored by a camera and locked gate which you had to buzz in to, to open and the elevators could only be used if you swiped your room key. It may sound a bit much to some, but itâ€™s good to know that they donâ€™t just let random people into the hotel when all your belongings are in your room. The pool was was adequate but it should have been heated because the water was freezing. The hot tub and pool closed very early so we didnâ€™t get to use them. The location of the hotel is great. It is very close to the airport, it is also very easy to get to South Beach or other attractions and there are a lot of restaurants and stores in the area. Overall it was a nice hotel and if they cleaned the bathrooms more thoroughly I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: blaisgerry
Reviews.Content: This hotel provides a shuttle service to the port of Miami and to and from the airport. It also provides secure indoor parking. Staff is very friendly and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: rlamond
Reviews.Content: Second time in a few years I've stayed here. Very friendly and accommodating staff. Easy shuttle ride to/from MIA. Good breakfast area and food. Recommend!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: coffeemavenswife
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as we arrived in Miami on a late flight. They provide shuttle service from the airport at any hour. We had a nice, clean room with two queen beds, a small table with two chairs, an armchair, desk, safe and flat-screen television. The bed was very comfortable. The shower was in the bathtub, which was a little difficult to get into. The rooms had w-fi, and the motel had two computers near the lobby for the use of guests. There was a great, expanded continental breakfast, which included eggs, breakfast meats, waffles, fresh fruit, yogurt and cereals.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Sofia B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel because we had a family reunion in Coral Gables. The location is fantastic, so convenient, easy access to everything, but the service was phenomenal. The hotel is very well run, the staff was very polite, the rooms very comfortable and impeccably clean, and we enjoyed the complimentary breakfast every morning. We most definitely come back, and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise Deal”
Reviews.Author: olegar31
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Hampton Inn and were pleasantly surpirsed to be upgraded to a suite...this has never happened to us before! In anticipation of a ten day cruise, we had earlier discovered that the Inn had a deal for cruisers who drive to Miami and need to park their car. We took this deal because it was much less costly than the Port of Miami parking and it included a complementary shuttle to the Port on the day of embarkation. The suite was large and spacious. We were able to wash our travelling clothes in the guest laundry and re-pack our vehicle bags for the trip home, ten days later. The hot breakfast, the next day, gave us a good start to our day of embarkation on the ship. Parking is in a secure, inside lot, with wire mesh chain link surrounding all sides. There is video surveillance and this gives great peace of mind if you are parking your vehicle for a period of time. There are a number of restaurants right across the road and the Inn provides several recommendations. We took their advice and were not dissapointed. "Victoria" was especially helpful and one of the most coureous people I have ever met. Today, at the end of our cruise we returned to find our car intact. We were able to use the business centre to make reservations for our next night on our driving trip back home. If we ever take another cruise out of the Port of Miami, we will consider this package again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Property”
Reviews.Author: MJ W
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hampton because I had an early morning appointment on the Jackson Hospital campus and wanted to be close by without the downtown Miami hustle and possible congestion in the morning. I found this property to be well run, very clean and more than acceptable. It obviously would be a good spot to be if one had an early morning flight since it is very close to the airport and is in my mind an airport hotel as that term is defined in other locations around the country. Parking is secured by electronic card access on the property, and there are fast food, drugstore, gas, coffee amenities within walking distance (although I might not recommend the walking part at night to those that are unfamiliar with Miami). The breakfast was very adequate and nicely presented. For price, this is a Miami bargain. Easy access to one of the main toll roads to downtown Miami and I-95 or I-395 to Miami Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Silvana M
Reviews.Content: In my 2 week stay I had great service, a few issues came up but the stuff was always very friendly. Specially the Alexandra the front desk girl, every time I needed something she was very courteous and remember me and my name. The rooms are very nice and clean and this hotel is in an excellent location, with easy to access to anywhere. The only issue I had is during the weekend when I tried to sleep in I could hear the cleaning people getting into the rooms next door and woke me up. But overall a great please to stay, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Sharon928
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in this hotel in Nov. 2011. I appreciated the airport shuttle. Pros: Hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. Room was comfortable and clean. Good internet access. Nice complimentary breakfast area and meal. I'd stay there again. Cons: none.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Iceteja
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome. Friendly staff, clean, great location, free breakfast, wifi and parking. Would recommend it to anybody!

Reviews.Title: “Finally, a hotel that fits just right.”
Reviews.Author: BoNote
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff is efficient and courteous. Room and bathroom were much cleaner and in better repair than the typical Miami hotel at this price point. Bathroom was well lit, with large mirror and counter, plenty of towels. Room was well designed and laid out, with plenty of lighting and outlets for the business traveler. Location is very handy if you don't have a car, with several stores and restaurants less than a block away. The original paintings in the lobby give a warm, elegant touch.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton's ofcourse!”
Reviews.Author: Marsha M
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed my stay at this Hampton location. The shuttle driver was very respectful and helpful. He helped me with my bags from the time he picked me up at the airport up until the elevator doors opened. I absolutely loved the fact that guests had to use their room card key to select the floor they are staying on when using the elevator. This is a added security measure. The gym has a nice variety of equipment to use and since I stayed on the 11th floor, I also made use of the stairwell several times, so I was able to get a simple yet effective workout in without spending hours in a gym. Since I had to be at the airport early, I did not get to dine in for breakfast; however, I can always depend on Hampton Inn to have breakfast grab bags available. I've been a repeat guest of Hampton Inn for over five years and the staff and the hotel have always met or exceeded my expectations. Another great feature of this location is the proximity to the airport. It's a quick 5 - 7 minutes trip which can make a world of a difference during peak-time traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Help is on the way!”
Reviews.Author: Ginger T
Reviews.Content: Amazing customer service, support and kindness from Alexandra and Kristin. Both of these young women went over and beyond to assist this infrequent traveler! Directions given while this traveler was lost with a GPS giving instructions in "Dutch". They stayed on the phone with me for 15 or more minutes and talked me through my daily drive home, they fixed my GPS, told me where to eat, and helped me solve rental car problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: amandaanne86
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights beginning on November 11th, 2011. Most of the reviews we read were positive and that is the main reason we decided to book this hotel. When we arrived at the airport, we called the hotel and were given instructions as to where we needed to be to catch the shuttle. We found it very easily and waited for less than ten minutes for the shuttle. I found this free shuttle to be extremely valuable. We were a group of five and renting a car, but we could not all go to pick it up becaue of all our luggage. Check in was fast and easy. They let us check in early and even without a credit card since it belonged to someone in the group who had gone to pick up the car. We were upgraded to a complimentary suite which was greatly appreciated as we had three women with a lot of luggage and who all take long to get ready to go out. The extra space made it a lot easier! Our suite had two double beds, a good size bathroom, a kitchen with dishes, full size fridge and microwave; and a separate living room. When we first arrived in our room our toilet was not working, but they promptly had it fixed while we were out so it was not a problem. Our room was on the 4th floor and it was clean, which is very important to us. We did not hear any airplanes while we were in the room and the beds were comfortable. We had a message on our phone and couldn't retrieve it one day, and the girl we spoke to at the front desk did not know how to retrieve messages either and told us she would find out and get back to us. However, she never did. The hotel was packed the weekend we were there, but it was still nice and quiet. Breakfast was free and that is greatly appreciated. However, we felt like it could be improved. The eggs were inedible all the days we were there. The breakfast potatoes were always overcooked and often too hard to eat. But they had the waffle maker, oatmeal, cereal, fruit and some other things. I always found something to eat, and this saved me from having to spend money on breakfast. We always had coffee and tea available which was nice. We didn't use the pool, but we relaxed outside. We tried to use the hot tub one night and it wasn't working, I'm not sure if it was closed or out of service. We would have gone swimming but it was cool outside in the nights and the pool is not heated. The patio area was nice though. The area around the hotel is good. There is a TD bank, CVS, Walgreens, Publix grocery store and some other things all across the street and within easy walking distance. It was also really easy to jump on the expressway and get to anywhere we had to go. It took us about twenty minutes if that to get to South Beach, ten minutes to Dolphin Mall, ten minutes to Miami International Mall and 30 minutes or less to Sawgrass Mills. For us, location was important even though we had a car, and I would say that this hotel is in an excellent location. Check out was very easy. We were leaving on a cruise and they were able to find last minute seats on a shuttle to the port for us that works with the hotel for ten dollars. Overall, I would not hesitate to book this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “paper thin walls”
Reviews.Author: 23Flipflops
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 9th floor. Room was clean, however the room/walls were thin. We could hear every door open/close, folks talking, coughing, etc. We have stayed at Hampton Inn's as the bed are usually very comfortable, but this one didn't seem to be as comfy. Room clean, staff nice, shuttle service seemed slow.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't find fault but confirm everything”
Reviews.Author: Balgownie
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night as we were leaving Miami the following day (Thanksgiving Day) and couldn't risk being caught in traffic. When we initially booked (through an agent) I made a mistake on the date. Despite the fact it was a non-refundable booking they changed it without cost. However it took several e-mails to get it confirmed and we also requested a late check out. We found the hotel very easily from the interstate. However we found that the booking had not been amended nor had the late check-out been approved. Fortunately we had taken a copy of the letter. They acknowledged the error and booked us in without any problems. I found all the staff were efficient, friendly, polite and helpful. We had free access to the internet to confirm reservations and get printed boaring passes. The room was spacious, spotlessly clean and had every facility one could expect. The pool was out of action but otherwise everything was fine. It has secure parking. There were plenty of OK local restaurants and fast food places. The hotel issued a warning about several restaurants that targetted travellers and offered poor food or had incorectly processed payments. There were plenty of gas stations to fill up the hire car before return. The area seemed OK. Breakfast was standard and OK with plenty of variety. Dining room staff were very cheerful and helpful. The journey to the airport was simple (two left turns and a 10-15 min drive). There is also a frequent shuttle to/from the airport. I don't think it is well located for visiting the beach areas but for what we wanted it fulfilled all our requirements and the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: kay-wren
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of having Alexandra B. checking my mother and me in for our 1 night stay before leaving on a cruise. She was great. She offered us an upgrade to a king suite that we declined. After a long day, we were both looking forward to our own queen beds and didn't want to share a bed or deal with a sofa sleeper. Not having many people turn down an upgrade, it took a bit of doing, but she was able to get us 2 queens. The room was great. We could see the planes take off but did not hear them. The breakfast was bigger and better than I expected. The shuttle to the Port of Miami went smoothly. I would stay again and encourage others not to be discouraged by the 2 star rating. The service is 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “A tad disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Roxy-Popsy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night in September. We've stayed several times before as with the free shuttle bus & convenient location to the airport, it makes sense after a 9 hour flight from the UK, plus the awful immigration queues of over 2 hours. I'd booked a fair while previously, & a couple of weeks before going, I noticed on their website that emergency water works repairs were being carried out. I 'phoned to ensure that these works wouldn't disturb us in any way & I was informed that the works had been completed. Otherwise we would have cancelled our booking & stayed elsewhere. We had to wait a fair while for the shuttle. Upon arrival, I noticed that pieces of carpet were missing from the sweeping staircase. The receptionist said she had upgraded our room to one with a sofabed as well & it was on the 8th floor. On the 8th floor corridor, there were strips of wallpaper lifted up in what looked like a way of trying to dry them out & also the walls. Our room was clean & quiet. We purchased salads from the store across the street & then ate them out on the patio area overlooking the pool. The furniture was contemporary style & comfortable, in all a pleasant hour or so. The bed was awful!!! One of the reasons we stay at Hampton Inn's is because the beds are so comfy. I should imagine that this was similar to sleeping on a water bed. Everytime one of us turned over the other one moved in a ripple effect. We felt nauseaous by morning after a very disturbed night's sleep, or lack of it. There were workmen still working at the hotel so the person I'd phoned before our arrival was, let's say, economical witth the truth. We got up early, had a quick breakfast & then caught the shuttle back to the airport to collect our hire car. We drove back to the Hampton, settled up & checked out. Before leaving I asked the receptionist about the quality of our bed & she said that some mattresses had been changed. I politely stated that we'd had an awful night's sleep & she said that she was sorry about that. It has made me think twice about booking a Hampton Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Recently Renovated”
Reviews.Author: Kat-thryn
Reviews.Content: Jeffrey is an excellent manager. We really liked coming here. He gave us a lovely tour of the hotel. This hotel while older has recently been renovated. It's location, the staff, the amenities and the creature comforts make it my first choice if you are having to overnight it in Miami at the airport location. There is a shuttle from the airport and we were picked up immediately. Right next to the front desk is a mini store where they sell snacks, beer, juices, drinks, etc. and we found this to be a handy convenience after flying in from the west that day. The room offers a comfy bed and in the morning we enjoyed a hot breakfast that I would call adequate. It is not cooked to order, but it does offer hot items. While there isn't an espresso bar, we found the coffee to be fresh and flavorful. And it was certainly superior to the meal offered on our flight that morning. We were very glad it was available. There is wireless internet also, and a spacious bathroom w a great shower.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Janna W
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here 9/26/11 during a time when they were repairing water damage from a broken sprinkler head. We arrived close to 11PM. The staff were friendly and helpful, offered us a late check out at no extra charge and assisted us in getting a meal at that late hour. Breakfast buffet was excellent, pool was serene. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: madge48
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a night after a long flight from London.We had a terrfic welcome from the 2 young ladies at the front desk who were dressed in comical Haloweeen costumes. Our room was large and very clean,really quiet which is exactly what we needed. We walked across the road to a small shopping centre and had a lovely meal in the Cuban restaurant,unfortunately I cannot remember it`s name but thoroughly recommend it. We had a great nights` sleep and enjoyed the complimentary breakfast,there was a good choice of both hot and cold food. Definitely a good base near Miami airport and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location close to airport”
Reviews.Author: spiritj
Reviews.Content: Well located hotel with great complimentary shuttle service to and from from Miami airport. Close to Walgreens, CVS, and several restaurants which make it a good choice for one night pre-cruise. Port shuttle service for a $10.00 pp fee is offered and well organized, with a choice of 11 am or noon. Free wireless internet as well as use of the business centre. Vents in hallways are very loud but constant , air conditioning in rooms is efficient. Breakfast typical Hampton Inn choices. Worth mentioning that staff and management is very friendly and genuinely helpful. All rooms are very clean . If staying longer pre or post cruise, would probably choose a hotel closer to port next time with a bit more atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Misleading Pricing”
Reviews.Author: Stuck_In_A_Cubicle
Reviews.Content: I've never noticed this before at any hotel, this one charges you an extra $10/person for each person beyond one. I've only seen this for numbers beyond two. Okay for a solo business traveler, but most vacation travelers are usually a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel without an own restaurant”
Reviews.Author: EduardKaupa
Reviews.Content: Hotel without an own restaurant I stayed in Hampton-Inn just one day, from Tuesday 25. Oct. 2011 to Wednesday 26. Oct. 2011,....but I was surprised that I got a Hotel without an own restaurant and that for the price from over 100,- $ the night,.....wow,.....that's really a dissapointment, when you think that this Hotel is just 10 minutes away from Miami-International-airport !!! The stuff is friendly and speaks english and spanish, and they help you if you have any questions,.....they have also a shuttle-service that picks you up from the airport and brings you back to the airport,.....for free !!! The rooms are okay,.....but the TV,....it takes you awhile till you figured out how to get a normal us-channel,.....but to buy a porno, you need just to push one button,.....that's really very bad !!! Okay, the breakfast is another thing,.....maybe its okay for us-american-standard, but not for international standart anymore,.....sorry,.....but everything in, on, or from papercups, that is really out of time when you pay over 100,- $ a single night !!! I think that the Hampton-Inn at Blue Lagoon needs an international-up-date to compare with Hotels in other countries !!! Thank you very much and have a great day, Eduard J. Kaupa

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Lynthefin
Reviews.Content: The staff is welcoming and goes out of their way to accommodate guests' needs. High-speed internet is also included, unlike some other properties in the area. The rooms are not luxury but have everything one needs - great beds, excellent bathrooms and they are very well cleaned. There may be no huge lobby like the Sofitel or Hilton, but the hotel will not disappoint. The pool area, just off the room where they serve breakfast (Include in room rate), is lovely. Management is clearly on top of everything and that trickles all the way down throughout the hotel. A good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but a few issues.”
Reviews.Author: Pinsinamap
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for one night as part of a flight layover. The shuttle picked us up as advertised and we only had to wait briefly outside of the terminal. The check-in was fast and friendly. The room we had was spacious but the carpets were disgusting. It looked dated and had many stains all over it. This hotel is frequented by â€œcruise peopleâ€� so you can get large numbers of huge guests checking in and out. If staying for business, choose your check out time wisely or do so using automated guest services. We did not have the breakfast or use the pool but the free coffee on tap was nice. Itâ€™s a shame the hotel did not have a bar and or restaurant as there is very little nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: cs03
Reviews.Content: Starting with the friendly shuttle driver front desk staff, I knew that this was the right choice for a short stay at MIA. As others have noted, the staff are all happy in their work as shown by the high level of friendly interaction with guests. The room was fine, as was the bed (and the rate). Much nicer than other properties in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Best Business Traveler Hotel in the Airport area”
Reviews.Author: Eric B
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at all the hotels in this airport area (Summerfield, Homewood, etc) and sadly this was the first time I stayed at this Hampton hotel. It was by far better than all of the others. It was better because a) the staff was amazing and friendly. They remembered my name each day I walked in the lobby. b) very convinient walk to a couple restaurants and grocery store. c) Free Wi-Fi, Parking, Shuttle, breakfast, etc d) Nice Clean Suites with a nice bed that wasnt a rock.

Reviews.Title: “Average airport hotel, but a shining star for MIA”
Reviews.Author: IntegrityTravel
Reviews.Content: My company sentenced us to the Crowne Plaza. Â I paid for this place out of pocket instead. I found this to be much better than the Crowne, but still not even up to snuff for a renovated Hampton. I chose this location based on reviews, then price. Â I wished I'd have paid a little more and gone to a Hilton Garden Inn. Anyways, found the hotel to be a bit older, a bit more beat up, but still I slept well, and the shower's water pressure was fantastic. Some housekeeping missteps when I first arrived such as missing laundry bag in the closet and room AC off when I entered so room was set to high 70s. I found the suite to be old, and though it wasn't dirty, it didn't feel clean. Â I personally wouldn't have used the fridge or any other kitchen amenities. The guy I dealt with at check-in was pleasant and the girl went out of her way to say Hi. Finding the hotel is easy, but pulling into the hotel is a chore with the way you're restricted to left turns off of 57th, forcing you to use 7th. Â Food options around the hotel aren't very good. Â There's a Wendy's and lots of Cuban places, and this awful 94th bomber group restaurant. Â I suggest drive east to Miami Beach or west to Doral for any decent food. Across the street is Walgreens and on the other corner CVS, both open 24hrs. Hotel parking is a bit goofy, and I arrived so late my last night that I was instructed to park it in front of the airport shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: LauriT911
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. The rooms were clean, the beds were comfortable, and the staff was friendly. We had no problems whatsoever. I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customerservice!”
Reviews.Author: lelici49
Reviews.Content: After traveling for 20 hours, we were longing to see a comfortable bed so we could start our yearly 4 week roadtrip through the USA. We were in for a major disappointment. We arrived to a flooded hotel that smelled damp and dirty. Someone hang up his clothes on the sprinklers, we were told. Constructionworkers everywhere, caution tapes, and ventilators raoring everywhere. I asked the deskclerk if these constructions would be going on all night. She said:"No, they will stop at 9pm", and we were offered a free bottle of water and a bag of chips as a compensation....wow! So we went up to our room, after jumping over several obstacles. Room looked ok, although i expected it to be a little more spacious. To my surprise the hamering was still going on at 11pm, so i asked one of this workers at what time they would stop. He told me they would be working around the clock. WHAT??? Back to the frontoffice to complain. After a brief discussion they offered to move me to a different Hampton in the neighbourhood. At 23.30 at night after 20 hours of traveling...don't think so! When she would have offered me this option at check in, i would have accepted it without hesitation, but not at this time. Packing our stuff again, go downstairs, wait for the shuttle, check inn at another hotel, unpack......come on! We didn't have much sleep that night due to the construction. I could not believe that they would perform construction, while a lot of guests where trying to sleep in their hotel. Unbelievable; we have a travel agency in Europe, and travel the US 2 months a year, and we have never experienced anything like this. Furthermore i though the compensation of a free bottle of water and a bag of chips were an insult. Managment should have refunded the full amount of each and every customer the nights during these constructions, or at least rewarded them an amount of HHonors points to have a free nights stay in another Hilton Hotel. On the other hand: breakfast was great the next morning, but that was the only positive thing during our stay. Sorry, but we can't recommend this hotel to our customers.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for a one night stay before a cruise.”
Reviews.Author: travelkidsanity
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night before our cruise the next day. The hotel is clean, has a nicely decorated entrance. There is a complimentary shuttle that is the hotel's which picks you up from the airport. We called the number that was on our reservation. We didn't have to wait to long for it. I think it was about 15mins. It would have been nice to have a friendly shuttle driver, but he didn't smile or even say hi. I was hoping at least the front staff would much more pleasant then the shuttle driver. The front staff was very nice, helpful and friendly. We arrived a few hours before check-in. We requested early check in. They didn't have a room ready, so went for lunch at which they put our luggage in a storage room ( which was actually the office). We came back and the room was ready,so we got into our room about a hour before usual check-in time. This hotel was in the process of a restoration ( There was a flood in the hotel due to a guest room sprinkler). We didn't have any visible wear on the 11th floor. While we were in the elevator a man got off on the third floor. You definitely could see the wallpaper coming down from the wall. Our room was on the 11th floor it was clean and bright. The view overlooked the waterway and a bit of the parking lot beside the hotel, but it wasn't a bad view. The bed was very comfortable, the ac in the room did make a bit of noise, but it didn't bother us. The t.v. had quite a lot of channels which was nice. The ac in the hallway was very loud it had a squealing sound to it. Luckily, we didn't hear it outside our door, but when we would go out you can hear it very clearly. There was complimentary internet. The internet connection was quite good. We did use the gym. The gym consist of treadmills, a stair climber, ellipticals, bikes, weight machines, a stretching apparatus ( you can do a variety of stretches on it), towels, a stability ball ( that could use air in it), there is a water cooler ( it was empty when we were there), There is a tv that you could watch a show if you wanted to. We did like that they had a large canister on the floor that had wipes it in that you could use to wipe off the machines or equipment that you use. There is a plaza across the street which has a Publix, Office Max, Subway, a couple of restaurants, Gamestop and others. Across from the plaza was a CVS store. And across from that was a Walgreens, Wendy's and other food places. There were convenient if you needed anything. The hotel also offer complimentary continental breakfast. It wasn't the best,but we still found something to eat. I have sent suggestions through their survey about their continental breakfast fare. This hotel offers a shuttle service through a company that will take you to the Port of Miami. It cost us $10 pp. Which was a good deal instead of taking a taxi which would be more. Overall, it was a good hotel especially for one night before a cruise or a flight.

Reviews.Title: “One noisy place”
Reviews.Author: Knevel
Reviews.Content: After a long 15 hour trip, I was happy that I booked a hotel near the airport. When arrived at the hotel, I could park my rentalcar under the building. The girl at the reception was very helpful and friendly. The hallway was very noisy with machine sounds, apparently from the A/C. The room was spacious and clean. Up till now, I was happy with my choice. However, the in the room A/C was also making a lot of noise. The metal cover was even vibrating. When turned off, somehow the noise was still present. When the hotel mechanic coulnd't fix the problem, I got another room. This was handled rather quickly, but it was late and the day already lasted a good 30 hours, so I was not happy with it. When entering the new room, there was still a lot of sound from the A/C, but luckily, the vibrating of the metal cover didn't occur here. From all the hotels i've stayed in, this was by far the noisiest room. If you can't stand mechanical sounds during the night or a constant blow, do go here. If you can stand that, the hotel is fine for you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for those who need to be close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: BrazilBackpack
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night between flights. Hotel is close to the airport and provides free-shuttle every 30 min from 5 am to 1 am. Check-in was fast and easy. The room is well maintained, clean, quiet and adequate in size. Breakfast is included, with many options (juices, yogurt, eggs, cereals, fruits, bread, croissant, etc). Walgreen's, Wendy's, Burger King, CVS and Gas station are conveniently located just around the corner. If you feel like going shopping, Dolphin Mall is a US$25-28 taxi ride away. The only downside is the lack of a minifridge in the room. Otherwise, perfect for a short stay while waiting for your flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Brett F
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a hotel with convenient location. For me, Hampton Inn & Suites is now highly recommended. Everyone at the hotel was super nice to me! Bedroom was good size, very clean and comfortable. Really good option for an easy stay in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoAussies
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 adults, 2 children arrived in Miami after 27 travelling hours from Australia. The shuttle bus stop was easy to locate, check in upon arrival at the hotel was quick and friendly. Our 2 queen bed room was clean, comfortable and welcoming. Little touches like the free business centre, fruit, and small convenience store were appreciated, given the late hour of our arrival. The complimentary breakfast surpassed our expectations. Plenty of hot food, replenished constantly, and a very generous selection of breakfast requirements served in a clean and comfy room. While our itinerary required us to be within close proximity of the airport, I was concerned about the noise. This was an unfounded concern, as none of us noticed any air traffic whatsoever. I spend many hours researching any type of accommodation for my family. I have never stayed at a Hampton Inn before, but after this very positive experience I would be most happy to consider this chain again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: LizzyW
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long haul flight and chose this hotel based on the reviews on trip advisor. I found the hotel to be dissapointing. The rooms were grotty, wallpaper in the corridors taped up, which was strange. The hotel seemed too run down that we didn't want to stay for the breakfast so left as soon as we could in the morning. I woudln't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: jperoni
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night before we got on our Carnival flight. They were a free airport shuttle and one of the few with a shuttle to the port. The shuttle to the port did have a small fee but it was cheaper than most others I called about. It's a safe neighborhood so we just went for a walk to a nearby plaza for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, old, so-so hotel with loud AC”
Reviews.Author: 365travelNYC
Reviews.Content: Arrived to a flooded hotel that smelled of fishy wet carpet. Construction, hammering, pounding, caution tape, and LOUD AC room units was my first and last experience at this hotel. Could not sleep that night...if the AC that sounded like a hovering helicopter did not keep me up, the construction did. I could not believe that they would perform construction into the late hours of the night. Of note, the staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great place Near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: betonic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn with my son this week for a quick layover from the airport. We travel regularly to Miami and always rent a car and head away from the airport but this time the flight arrived at 7pm and we had to be back at the airport at 8am. I booked this hotel based on the consistent service with Hampton Inn and the reviews here. When we arrived at the airport I call from the phone by baggage claim and the operator was very nice. We were told to go upstairs and wait by the departures level and we given a very specific description of what the van looked like. We waited about 5 min for the van and the ride to the hotel was less than 10min. The front desk staff was very nice and our room was a standard Hampton Inn room. The only negative I can think of is that they were having som kind of work done on a water leak so you could see the wallpaper in the hallway pealing or lifting up. Our room was not effected, just the hallways. The hotel as a CVS, Walgreens and a Publix in walking distance. We ate dinner at an Italian Restaurant in the Publix shopping center and it was very good and convenient. I would stay here again if I needed to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Neile7
Reviews.Content: After an enjoyable 10 hour flight from LHR we arrived in Miami and sped through customs. The Hotel offers a free transit from the airport, which is every 1/2 hour. TIP - Go to the 2nd level outside and flag/hail down the hotel mini-bus, from what we gathered there was no specific stand for each hotels bus. Check-in was OK with 1 serving and 1 on the phone and we waited about 10 minutes. The rooms are clean and comfortable, with free wi-fi an assortment of tv channels, coffee, iron, board etc. There is also an on-site fitness room, but with jet lag and a long drive in the morning that wasn't an option on this occassion. There seemed to have been a major leak from the top floors, as there was a bit of renovation going on in the main area stairs and hallways, with wallpaper coming away from the walls. Not a good 1st impression, but the rooms were good, which was the important part. Breakfast is on the 2nd floor and has an assortment of breads/pastries, yoghurts and a waffle making utensil. There is also omletes and sausage meat if you want something warm. Drinks are fruit juices and coffees. Next day we picked up a rental at the airport and the hotel shuttle dropped us off. TIP - if your rental company does it, CHECK-IN ONLINE, this means you go to the 3rd floor of the airport, take the transit train, go past all the queues and go straight to the garage for your vehicle. Make sure you have your checked-in rental agreement, holiday rental voucher, original credit card and driving licences for all drivers. Overall this is your usual american hotel and was great for a night stop, to recharge your batteries after a long trip, as it is very close to the airport of which I couldn't hear a thing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Chrisquitolindo
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent if you arrive in late or need to leave early in the morning. Many shops around and extremely easy access from the airport. The rooms are quiet and clean. Breakfast is disappointing. Excellent customer service manager who really cares about customer satisfaction but some reception staff members hardly fit the picture (not interested in their job it seems). These were our second and third visits. The first was a far better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: teddy_scot
Reviews.Content: Choose this location on basis of price and excellent reviews. It turned out to be excellent choice. Had car, so travvelling in to Miami and the Miami Beach was easy 10 minute drive. Room was clean and comfortable., Free Breakfast was excellent. Parking was free and secure. Staff couldnt do enough. Also excellent fitness centre, Free Wi FI and internet facility. What more could you need. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here..Best Hotel near Miami Airport!! Very Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovemesumhotsauce
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel so much that I didn't want to leave. The front desk clerks were so nice and on top of their game! Yandy & the sales office clerk were wonderful. The rooms were in excellent condition. The breakfast was so yummy! I worked out in the gym & used the computers in the business office. Trust me, stay here. You won't be disapointed!

Reviews.Title: “The customer service was excellent.”
Reviews.Author: margie a
Reviews.Content: The desk managers and hotel staff provided excellent customer service. Yandy in particular was efficient, courteous and the ultimate professional. I predict he will go far in the hotel and hospitality industry. He clearly loves his job and and it shows in the way he interacts with customers. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay while there.
