My daughter and I were weary travelers who arrived at the hotel very early in the morning after enduring a 22 hour drive from Washington, DC. We were allowed to check in early and we were truly appreciative of the reception we received. I have stayed at Hampton Inn hotels in Jacksonville, Columbia, SC and Alexandria, VA and have always enjoyed excellent service and accomodations. Good job Hampton Inn!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay and Service”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn H
Reviews.Content: Aftere a cancelled flight from Miami to Washington, DC due to hurricane Irene, my son and I were stranded in Miami for an evening. On short notice we made the reservation with my reliable Hampton Inn and the service was great. We were greeted warmly, had accommodationson the Hilton Honors floor, were given information on where to dine, and then provided a prompt shuttle service to return to the airport to make our flights. This is why I return to Hampton Inn! It provides excellent service and clean , hospitable accommodations whenever I need it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: eke_brown
Reviews.Content: Stayed here going and coming through Miami from an out of the countrry flight. Both stays were enjoyable. The staff were friendly, the rooms clean, and the location is convenient to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: dgeronimopo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the middle of everything. South of the Miami airport, close to Palmetto expresswayaand the 836 highway to get eastbound and westbound. There is a plaza just across the street with Publix supermarket, also drugstores Cvs and Walgreens at walking distance. Also breakfast included and airport shuttle. Also close to Mall of the Americas and Dolphin mall.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed once, decided to stay twice”
Reviews.Author: spkiara
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband booked this hotel for two nights picking it up for being near to the airport and for having a free shuttle to and from it. We got much more. Wide and comfortable room, which was also very clean. You can find everything you need in it: tv, playstation, strongbox, electric iron and board, coffee machine, free wi-fi. The hotel has also a business centre with three internet PCs you can access for free. There's a small shop to buy snacks, juices etc. I paid 129$+tax and breakfast was included. We truly appreciated we could choose from a variety of hot beverages, cold milk, cold cereals, kinds of breads and pastries to toast, eggs, omelettes, sausages and more. The breakfast room was quite comfortable and had the view on a terrace with pool which looked very pleasant (but I didn't use it!). The value added of the hotel is that you have the feeling of being home, of finding people ready to help in whatever you need. The hotel has, for example, an agreement with a nearby car rental agency for special prices with the hotel customers. For all these reasons when a week later we were forced to stay two nights in Miami due to problems with our flight, we didn't have any doubt in booking there again. One of the manager of the hotel gave us also very good suggestion on how to use ground transportation to get to Miami Beach from the airport where we could get to by using the hotel shuttle. The hint was great and with less than 5$ we could easily go to Miami Beach and back to the hotel. At the end of our double stay we were fully satisfied with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hampton, it'd be great only if . . .”
Reviews.Author: 294SC
Reviews.Content: . . . the mattress wasn't so firm that I could have ironed my clothes on it. In fairness, on the return leg of this business trip the room I had came with a very comfortable bed, but that first one reminded me of sleeping on a futon. Super clean, very friendly front desk. I'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep ever”
Reviews.Author: Manamaeva
Reviews.Content: I was delighted with my stay: The staff was very courteous in replying to my email and giving advice beforehand. I arrived at 6am after missing my flights fearing that my booking for that previous night would be lost: what I did receive what excellent service and an upgrade to a huge room with a kitchenette and a lounge room. The bedding was the nicest I have encountered. Firm, smooth duvet, and very clean. I had an interrupted sleep and grabbed a breakfast to go with an apple, a muffin and a bottle of water. I've been travelling extensively for five weeks and that one night next to an airport is my best experience so far! I will be back and recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, the best hotel in Miami!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carmen P
Reviews.Content: The best area, near of CVS Pharmacy, Walgreens, Subway, Wendy's, Pollo Tropical, Casa Juan Restaurant, Gas station, TD Bank., Publix. The employees are excellent, Randy in front desk is excellent. I feel very good in this hotel!!!! When i return to Miami, I go to this hotel again!! We loved it and we'll be back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: KFG0712
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Sunday before a cruise and the place was wonderful. Shuttle survice from the airport was free and the accomodations were great. Free breakfest was first rate. Would highly reccommend this fine inn.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a preflight hotel”
Reviews.Author: CCMcC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here twice in August, both times as I waited for flights at Miami International. The hotel staff is very cheerful and responsive. The rooms are of a lower quality for the Hampton chain, but large and clean. No Weather Channel on the TV, though, which is odd for business travelers. And no in-room microwave and refrigerator, either, which is not typical for the chain. Breakfast is the standard fare and good. Pool a little small, but I doubt people come here for that. The hotel is helpfully positioned across the street from a shopping center with Starbucks, Publix, and other chain restaurants. I left items here on the first trip and the hotel actually had them waiting for me when I returned two weeks later. THAT is commendable. Hotel shuttle goes every half-hour to the airport. Pick up is on the second floor at the airport and you need to find the van that says Hampton Blue Lagoon, because there are other Hampton Inn vans operating there, too. If you don't want to wait for the shuttle, make sure to ask for a BLUE taxi because apparently there will be a HUGE scene if you get into a yellow cab and ask to be taken to a local hotel. They will all begin yelling that you need to get a BLUE taxi.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: alexgn59
Reviews.Content: Good location, Outstanding breakfast !!! Free secured parking,

Reviews.Title: “A Real Winner!”
Reviews.Author: lovesf48
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for several reasons. It included a free airport shuttle, a hot breakfast and was close to shopping so we could pick up items we didn't want to deal with in our carry on luggage. All 3 of these were perfect. The shuttle was easy to spot and delivered us efficiently. A short walk to the corner took us to Walgreens. CVS and Publix were across the street. As well as the restaurants the hotel mentions, there was a Wendy's, McDonalds, and Burger King close by. The room was typical for a Hampton, quiet, and the air conditioning worked extremely well. The pool and hot tub are on the second floor and the area is huge. The breakfast was one of the most varied and well stocked I've seen. They had omelets, bacon, potatoes, waffles, pastries, bagels, toast, yogurt, oatmeal, juices, milk, hot beverages and fresh fruit. There was peanut butter as well as cream cheese along with the usual jams, honey and butter. Even the cold cereal was varied, with selections for both kids and adults. If you were in a rush, they had breakfast to go bags at checkout that contained a muffin, granola bar and water. These had colorful stickers denoting what was inside and I saw several choices. The hotel had a security feature I've never seen, although I never saw any need for extra security precautions. In order to get to your floor, you had to swipe your hotel key card. We had already done this when another guest entered the elevator. He was unable to select a different floor until he had swiped his own key card. In the morning, the US Today was under our door and checkout was a breeze. The shuttle to the cruise ports they had arranged was on time, polite, and only $10 p/p.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for an overnight stay near the Miami airport”
Reviews.Author: TravelandFoodGlutton
Reviews.Content: I arrived late at night from Latin America on a flight requiring an overnight stay in Miami prior to an early morning return home to Boston.. I got the hotel's shuttle fairly quickly at the airport, and settled in quickly and efficiently to a comfortable room. There was excellent service at the front desk. The approximately $100 rate included breakfast, or, in the alternative, breakfast to go, if you have an early morning flight that requires you to leave for the airport before breakfast is served. The breakfast-to-go was certainly very basic - a couple of mini-cereal bars, a piece of fruit, and a bottle of water, all placed in paper bags at the front desk and ready as early as 5 in the morning, when I had to take the shuttle to the airport. It was not an ideal breakfast, for sure, but it was a nice touch. It certainly beats the "sorry, you're leaving too early to get breakfast" that you would be told at most hotels. But then again, the price, at around $100/night when I was there, is a bit on the high side for this 2-3 star hotel that is simply an airport hotel with very modest accommodations.. However, it nonetheless does favorably compare to other hotels near the airport, in terms of price and quality, at least judging by the looks of the hotels listed and available for online reservations in the area. The alternative I almost chose is the one hotel that is actually located right in the airport itself - the Miami International Airport Hotel. The only reason I did not choose that other hotel was that it was considerably more expensive - at $30-40 more per night.. To me it was not worth the difference just to avoid a hotel shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight stay for business travellers.”
Reviews.Author: OldBeginner
Reviews.Content: I arrived late in Miami to find a 30min Queue for taxi's so I rang the hotel, a friendly receptionist said I was expected and would send the shuttle and within 5 mins I was on the shuttle bus and 5 mins later I was at the hotel while my colleague who was staying downtown was still queing for his taxi. I received a warm welcome and all ameneties were explained to me - gym, pool, comp breakfast or breakfast bag if I was leaving before 6am, which I was. The room was spotless, a good size with tea, coffee, internet, good shower, king bed, desk etc. All in all just what a business traveller needs.. Next morning my 'breakfast to go' was waiting for me and I was off - on the shuttle again!!

Reviews.Title: “If Leaving/Arriving from/to Miami Airport...Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: BonitaIronman
Reviews.Content: Needed a room arriving MIA at 11:30 pm. No problem, shuttle runs until 1:00 am. Needed to park my car there for 14 days (I live on Florida's west coast). No problem, a 2-deck garage, with the first deck under cover. Get the package that includes the room AND the parking privilege. Full buffet breakfast is included with room rate. The property is clean (only negative is carpet in room needs replacing) and well managed...the front desk agent informed me a total renovation is planned before year's end. I was upgraded to a suite (without asking)...the bedding was clean and fresh and being less than a mile from an active runway, you do not hear planes. Sparkling large bathroom with a shower stream that will take your skin off, if you want that. I wanted it. Understand, this was not a vacation spot but after almost 28 hours travelling from eastern Europe and Asia Minor, it was just what we needed for 8 hours of rest.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: BGriesbach
Reviews.Content: We had short but sweet stay at this hotel. The staff was very friendly and special needs were attended promptly and conveniently. They held our luggage for a couple of days, with no charge. Only thing that we missed, was a in-room fridge. Would recommend at any time.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Once Again”
Reviews.Author: aussiehikers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for only one night and arrived very late after delays at Miami International Airport...Check in was a breeze...They retrieved some packages that had been held pending our arrival and we were in our room 5 min utes after arrival...the room was spotlessly clean and the bed very comfortable...wifi worked very well...Had no time for breakfast this time and the shuttle transfer was quick and easy...we will be back again very soon for our 7th visit...Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: valueseeker29867
Reviews.Content: Excellent room and public areas. Outstanding breakfast. Dining in strip mall across the street is limited but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Airport and Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cunindk
Reviews.Content: It is an Hampton which just about sums up the hotel. For those unfamiliar with Hampton. Its a 2 to 3 star hotel that does what it says on the package. Decent, clean at an average price. There is free secured parking, internet and complementery breakfast. The breakfast room is a bit too small in our experience but it works out with some patience. It is close to the airport and it is easy enough to locate. There is drugstores and a gas station across the street(s) which is practical. The neighborhood is not too charming. Drab airport/big City residential is about it. The hotel is nice if you are here for transit (cruise, airport, car roundtrip) for a single day or so, but if you are here to see Miami, I'd recommend something located closer to the main areas (south beach, coconut grove etc).

Reviews.Title: “Late night shuttle driver nasty and very rude!”
Reviews.Author: mainecoon18
Reviews.Content: He completely turned us off this hotel, and we stayed at the Hitlon Garden Inn and it was wonderful! Much more reasonable and the shuttle driver was not a total rude a@@. Maybe he should find another job if he is so miserable, that is no way to live.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely efficient and friendly service. Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: AlejandroGandara
Reviews.Content: I found my stay and this hotel very satisfactory. The staff was ready to help with my request, even before the check in process when I received an international call from my office. Bi-lingual front desk staff was a plus, specially when sorting out some minor issue with my billing (which was fully solved by email after my return to Colombia). The breakfast to go is an extraordinary idea and was useful during my trip to the airport and waiting before my plane departed. 5 start indeed!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful value!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaTravelchick
Reviews.Content: We took advantage of the park, stay and fly package. What a wonderful deal this is and thank you Hampton Inn for offering it. We left our car in the COVERED parking area, took the hotel shuttle to Miami airport and flew to Rome! When we came back, the shuttle picked us up at the airport and delivered us to the hotel. They even upgraded our room for us! We had a wonderful breakfast, took a dip in the very nice pool and away we went! Large room, clean and neat. The breakfast was wonderful and plentiful. You just can't ask for much more!

Reviews.Title: “highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Alre59
Reviews.Content: Actually a lot of quality. All the amenities and friendly staff. I recommend it. Our stay was very satisfactory. And the advantage of being near the Miami Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: cautiousmom7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel based on the many excellent reviews. The hotel is certainly adequate. Just unremarkable. As with many Hampton Inns, the staff was nice and the room was clean. But the hotel itself was drab and the mattresses felt old and saggy. There are better hotels in Miami for the price--and we had a discounted rate. Of course, the reviews reveal a problem with Tripadvisor's formula: A 3-star hotel that delivers well on its 3-star status could outrank a 5-star hotel that falls a little bit short of its status. We moved to a 4-star hotel that wasn't perfect (key card problem, a/c switch needed repair). But it was much classier, better located, and the same price as this Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Can't believe this hotel is ranked #2!”
Reviews.Author: TexasAggie91
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for business and the staff was friendly however, the TV wasn't working so I called down to have someone check it out. A couple of guys came up to look at it and decided it was the cable server and would check that and call back. After 2 hours no call from the service guys so I called the front deck and they said they were still working on it. 4 hours later and no call so I once again called down to the front desk where there has been a shift change and they were not aware of the issue so they sent up someone else who came up with the same conclusion and you guessed it, would get back with me. Never heard from him. I asked to move to another room and the Hotel reluctantly did. As a Hilton rewards member I expect better service.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn was VERY helpful amidst a disasterous start to vacation”
Reviews.Author: Akron40years
Reviews.Content: I was not able to board the cruise ship with my family in Port Canaveral and was told to drive to Miami to secure an emergency passport. Only having my purse, cell phone and a phone charger, I found the Hampton Inn was in the vicinity and had rooms at reasonable rates. I arrived distraught, but was met with a kind front desk person and words of encouragement. She was able to provide me a toothbrush, paste and a razor. She mentioned the WalGreen across the street, where I picked up a couple other necessities. They gave me great directions and advice for the passport office and the free internet saved me from guessing about flights to get from Miami to St. Thomas and where to stay in St. Thomas. The room was clean and comfortable. The secure garage was a blessing for a single woman traveling alone!! I would highly recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “I can always count on a great stay at the Hampton Inn - Miami Airport South”
Reviews.Author: kstadler
Reviews.Content: I travel every 8 weeks to Miami for business and I always try to stay at the Hampton Inn - Miami Airport. It is conveniently located, since I have to visit customers in the Miami and Ft. Lauderdale area. The staff is always ready to help you and very accomodating. It is rare that you find a hotel in Miami w/ free parking and free breakfast. I will always make Hampton Inn - Miami Airport South my first choice! Thanks Jeffrey!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ADM12
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 1 night prior to our cruise! we received complimentary transportation from the airport to the hotel which we appreciated but it had a few problems, since I had to call the hotel a few times before the transportation arrived. Check in was simple, we also booked cruise transportation from the hotel which was on time! The room was clean and comfortable! The hotel is convenienlty located near a few fast food restaurants, a Publix grocery, CVS, Walgreens etc. Breakfast is complementary with choice of eggs, waffles, pastries/muffins, toast/english muffins, fruits, yogurt etc. Very fulling! I would stay at this hotel again for a short stay in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “We have a great time”
Reviews.Author: maggie154980
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night after our cruise and it was a great time. We were there hours early and they allowed us to lock our bags in their office, invited us to eat breakfast and use the pool even though we weren't checked in yet. The rooms were spacious and very clean. Will definately go back. The only thing I would change is the size of the pool towels!

Reviews.Title: “Trip advisor's reco could never be so disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Carlos23
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed for having followed TA's recommendation for this hotel in Miami. My room carpet had spots, the bathroom sink smelled mold, the room was pretty small and the pillow were too small and uncomfortable. I would only recommend this hotel for those who want to be really close to Miami's intl airport. I had a prepaid room (non reimbursible!) and when I got to the front desk on my check in the receptionist could not find that information. She ahd to ask for her boss to figure out how to read it...

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: quigie
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Hampton on our way to & from a cruise from Barbados.We stayed in January 2011 & then again in April 2011. Shuttle from the Airport is great although a bit hard to find the pick up point the first time.Staff very friendly,breakfast adequate & ABOVE ALL the rooms were VERY CLEAN!! The Cuban Restaurant nearby( in the shopping centre precinct) is not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Chriscris
Reviews.Content: Stayed here overnight before picking up a hire car. Shuttle bus staff friendly and helpful - as were the rest of the staff. Room was as expected and breakfast good as part of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Convenience to Airport. Good Night's Rest.”
Reviews.Author: pvflmom
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay close to airport for early morning international flight. On line booking allows you to pick your room in advance, but didn't know layout of hotel, so waited until I arrived. First room backed to elevators, so requested a change to quieter location. They quickly accommodated, but we were a little leery when the new room was next to a room that had the door completely taped around all edges. You'd think they would have steered us somewhere else. My daughter's vivid imagination had all types of scenario's for the reason. Not to worry. We were fine. Room was quiet, beds were comfortable, room was clean- all that I have come to expect at a Hampton. Good night's sleep. They have shuttle service to airport that apparently a lot of people use. I was just dropping daughter off and driving out of town, so we didn't use them. Gated, enclosed FREE parking garage was nice.They had an adequate breakfast ready on time. Desk Staff were helpful with directions. Overall good experience and recommend for similar situations. Free internet is always a good plus.

Reviews.Title: “Last night before heading home - not a fan of the area”
Reviews.Author: lassie
Reviews.Content: I have only ever stayed in Miami once before for one night (Hyatt Regency Coral Gables) and you can't really compare these two. I used TA to guide me on where to stay the night before heading back home. We drove there from the Gulf Coast but passed the entrance to the hotel car park so ended up having to circle the area. it was less than appealing to me but to be fair not a lot of near-airport areas are. Check in was fine, rooms were as expected, no problems. There is a secure car park, which is great. There was a security guard at the door of the hotel too.I am not sure if this is just at night or 24 hours. We did try to book a last minute tour of the city for the next morning but the concierge(or vendor) kept changing the price and then said it had to be cash the night before and we were uneasy about it so we just decided not to go ahead. We had a stroll along South Beach and went to the Bayside Marketplace. We used the Chinese restaurant across the road recommended by the hotel. Maybe we are spoiled, we have an excellent one near our home but this one (in the shopping plaza) was poor in our opinion and we did not feel very safe at night in the area so although we liked the hotel and thought they did a good breakfast, we would not go back to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great overnight spot”
Reviews.Author: islandladytraveler
Reviews.Content: Due to flight schedules, I booked this hotel for an overnight on my way back from hiking the Inca Trail in Peru. Nedless to say, I was a bit weary and all I wanted was a good night's sleep before heading home. Even though there was a mall just across the street with a well recommended Cuban restaurant, I was so tired I opted to order pizza delivered. If I had ventured out, I knew I was in a safe area to walk about. I was absolutely delighted to find the bedding was so soft and luxurious, I slept like a baby. The complimentary breakfast the next morning was way more than I ever expected...feasted on waffles! The pool area was inviting, though I didn't have time to use it. All this and the price was extremely reasonable. I will definitely book this hotel any time in the future when I have a layover in Miami, and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: MissIzzy
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews. My husband & I needed a place to stay b4 flying to Peru. This place far exceeded my expectations. The front desk staff was efficient and extremely friendly. We had planned to park @ a commercial parking lot close to the airport, and the mgr suggested we pay a little higher rate and leave our car n the hotel parking garage. Great deal for us, and our car was protected. The shuttle drivers were helpful and courteous, and the shuttle runs every 15 min or so. The driver actually came in to the lobby to let us kno he was ready to leave and get your bags! We left too early for breakfast, but they have a packed snack for you to take away. The pool area is clean and pretty, and the jacuzzi worked fine. The room was clean and the beds (although they did look lumpy!) were so comfy. We slept great. I look forward to staying here again on my next trip to Miami!

Reviews.Title: “best service ever!”
Reviews.Author: RP-Netherlands
Reviews.Content: we arrived at Miami International airport at 6PM, collected the rental car, and drove to this hotel in 5 min. We were planning to stay only 1 night, because we had booked the next few nights at Islamorada. that 1 night was very pleasant. The hotel is clean, the rooms are big and clean, the beds are good, there is safe parking in the private parking garage, and there is a nice swimming pool. On top of that, there is complimentary breakfast, which is quite elaborate, and the staff are very friendly and helpfull. I had fogotten to pack my toothbrush, so I got a new one from the receptionist, and toothpaste! they also told us where to find a couple of good restaurants (whithin minutes walk from the hotel). There are a couple of computers with internet and printer available for guests. In the morning, they told us how to get on the way to the Keys. An excellent start of our vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “What's with the bedding?”
Reviews.Author: mvdljca
Reviews.Content: I had to overnight in Miami due to a cancelled flight, and chose the Hamper because it was cheap at $129, convenient and highly rated on TA. It's pretty standard issue Hamper and a good value, as are most of their other properties I've visited. But when I checked in and went to the room, I was startled to find the condition of the bed -- all lumpy. I pulled back the bedspread and the bed appeared to have been slept in and not changed. See photo. I asked for another room, and discovered the same thing. On closer inspection, the sheets were clean, and everything turned out fine. I still don't understand the Martian surface bedspread and wrinkly sheets (maybe they don't iron them to save money), so Hamper, if you're reading this, maybe pin a note to the pillow with a brief explanation.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Practical”
Reviews.Author: brizzyguy
Reviews.Content: This was just a one night pre-cruise stay, and did the job very nicely. It was clean, quiet and the beds were very clean and comfortable. I had such a good rest, after the long flight in from LAX. The free shuttle service from the airport was excellent, I only had to wait about 5 mins. Also, the taxi ride to the Port of Miami the next morning was only $25, which I felt was pretty good for 3 x adults and all that baggage. The location is convenient if all you need are provisions from the supermarkets and fast food joints across the road, but if you prefer to have a look around the beaches and places of interest before your cruise, you may rather want to find a place on South Beach where all the excitement is right at your door. This hotel is good value if you count the complimentary hot breakfast and internet. The rooms are rather plain, don't expect too much. Hint: There is a Radio Shack store across the road, in case you need last minute camera/electronics for your cruise. Also, I was able to purchase a pre-paid SIM card for my iPhone from the AT&T agency across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay near MIA airport!”
Reviews.Author: forgiven77
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay at this HI and we've never been disappointed. Just a short shuttle ride from airport, always receive prompt and friendly service from the front desk and never had problems with reservations. Walked across the street to a little sit-down Chinese restaurant (China House) that was the best, homemade, no MSG. Yum. There was also Cuban and Italian restaurants as well as Burger King and Subway where you can walk safely. Room was quiet and clean, a/c worked great, bathroom clean. Definitely will return when we have morning flight out of Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Lay Your Head”
Reviews.Author: Exbeachers2
Reviews.Content: I was between flights and needed a room for a snooze and shower. The taxi driver was a recent arrival himself and couldn't find an "inexpensive" hotel for me, so, as I could see the Hampton sign from the highway, I directed him (and $15.00US later) to the hotel. The front desk was quite accommodating for my needs, and gave me a nice 2nd floor room. Bed was comfy and clean, pillows gave enough support, and the room didn't have the lingering smells you sometime find. The shower and bathroom were spotless, lots of hot water and fluffy towels. Got the wake up call I asked for, enjoyed the complimentary breakfast with a few other weary travellers. All in all, exactly what I needed. The only problem was a lingering bug spray or cleaning smell in the lobby as I waited for the shuttle...gave me a bit of a cough, but it disappeared when we reached the airport. Other than that, a nice nights stay. Pura Vida

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Pre Cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brianscreename
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Blue Lagoon for one night prior to joining a group of friends on a 3 night weekend cruise. It is a perfect pre-cruise location, five minutes from the hotel with a complimentary airport shuttle. In addition, they are across the street from a shopping mall that includes a grocery store and Starbucks. The hotel is a two minute walk from Walgreens, CVS, McDonalds and Wendy's. Free breakfast is included, and was quite good. Rooms and clean and spacious, beds quite comfortable. I was upgraded to a one bedroom suite, which was absolutely huge!! For ten dollars the hotel sets you up with transportation to the pier, which is about a 15 minute ride. All in all, the hotel far exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Not What we Expected”
Reviews.Author: BoboToronto
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here on April 9 prior to our cruise. Normally Trip Advisor reviews are fairly accurate, but for this Hotel, not so much. We are not picky travelers, but expect, at the very least, the rooms to be clean for close to $200/night. My Wife and daughter were highly turned off by the cleanliness of the bacthroom. Hair and dirt were in all corners of the bathroom. We did call down for another room and was told they were full and could not offer anything else. Since it was late, we were not about to have somebody come up to clean the bathroom when it should have been cleaned prior to our arrival. Air conditioning was very loud and would wake you at any hour. Overall Hotel needs a major reno as it shows much wear and tear. I believe travelers get hooked by the shuttle service & breakfast that is included in the room rate. We were expecting much more from the Hilton Chain

Reviews.Title: “Our stay was excellent”
Reviews.Author: BelizeBermuda
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying at Hampton Inn Blue Lagoon because, it is clean, spaceous, comfortable and convienent, with excellent service and great breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near airport for a great value”
Reviews.Author: Samicide
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the final night of our week in Key West and Miami Beach as we had an early morning flight home the following day. The location and proximity to the airport was perfect- just a few exits away on the dolphin expressway. We were able to get to the airport rental car center within 10 minutes. Check in was fast and courteous. Rodney welcomed me to the property and explained the shuttle service (we didn't need it so cant comment), free breakfast, internet and parking and sent me on my way within minutes. The rooms were fine however we weren't really expecting much else than somewhere to stay near the airport. It featured a king bed, flat panel tv and a bathroom with a shower only (which was requested). I also received a great rate (under $100) by booking directly and only a week or so before. Our room was on the north side of the building on the top floor and had a wonderful full view of the airport field. As an aviation geek, that was an extra bonus! The free breakfast internet and parking were greatly appreciated, in an area where hotels will nickel and dime you for such amenities. To the person who complained of the steep parking entrance: why didn't you just park on the lower level?? Its covered, secure and I had no issues getting in. We didn't spend much time at the hotel itself other than to sleep and about an hour or so after checking in. We used the pool in that time and it was a bit dirty with lots of leaves and a few bugs floating about. Id suggest to management that it be cleaned more often. It was a milder day and the unheated pool was a bit uncomfortable so we moved to the hot tub, but the button that controlled the hot tub was not working. We didn't come here specifically to swim and were just killing time before dinner so this wasn't a huge deal. We went to south beach for dinner, which was just a short drive and straight shot down the dolphin expy, and returned later that evening to retire for our early am flight. The walls are a bit thin and you can hear conversations from the hallways. Doors slamming shut from other rooms also shook the walls. This made it noisy as people were checking into their rooms but it remained quiet through the night. The hotel information book had an interesting comment regarding local pizza businesses placing advertisements under hotel doors. They did not recommend guests using these businesses as there were complaints about product quality and bad service. Soon after I read about this, someone placed a menu under our door and I promptly opened the door and returned the menu to the woman and tried to tell her we didn't need it (but I don't think she understood English). My question is if the hotel doesn't want you using these restaurants, why do they let them in the hotel in the first place? You'd think they would recognize the same people with stacks of menus or see them on the cameras putting unsolicited advertisements into their guest's rooms. I think the hotel should do something about this. Its also a potential security risk. Overall I was satisfied and would stay here again for an early morning flight, but not for an entire vacation stay.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT MIAMI AIRPORT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: birthdayvacation
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn and Suites last night after driving back from Key West, and before leaving on an early flight home. The hotel receptionist, Christine, went out of her way to see that the hotel shuttle picked us up from our rental car agency, which was not located at the central airport rental car location. This saved us from taking a shuttle to the airport and then waiting for the hotel shuttle at the airport. After a long drive, we were very pleased that Christine accomodated our request. The hotel was clean and directly across the street from a strip mall. We ate an Italian Restaurant in the mall area, it was fine. The breakfast in the morning was adequate. I would certainly stay here again. We did not use the pool. We did use the buisness center to print boarding passes, the computer was not the fastest, and it shut down twice while I was using it, but in the end, I had my boarding passes.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: San Juan de los Morros, Venezuela
Reviews.Title: “Perefect Hotel for business at Miami”
Reviews.Author: ierivero
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel several times for business and leisure. For business, I don't think there is a best place stay on Miami, based on Value, than this one. The rooms are confortable to work and the location could not be better: it is close to majors Highways and Interstates, Convenience Stores, Pharmacies and Fast Food Restaurants to a Walking distance and Airport is 3 minutes from the Hotel. I definitely will not change this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: CurvyDivaLady
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room. Cleaning and breakfast staff were very friendly, free breakfast was good. Pool not as big as expected but nice. Parking was free. You need your room key at all times. Lobby not much and really small but very clean. Front desk staff helpful but not very welcoming. We had a small plumbing issue but no big deal. Only 10 min drive from south beach if no traffic. Traffic adds 30-40 minutes. Very convenient to airport, no noise at all. CVS, Walgreens, restaurants across the street

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT HOTEL - PERFECT IN EVERY RESPECT”
Reviews.Author: bobkent
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night after flight from UK prior to driving to Sanibel next day via US 41. This hotel is very close to the airport but easy to find and in what appears to be quite a safe location. The welcome was efficient and friendly and the hotel provides free secure parking for the duration of your stay. Despite being close to a main road and the airport the rooms are quiet, being well soundproofed. The room was spacious, extremely clean and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have come across in a hotel. There is a Publix supermarket just across the road as well as restaurants, we eat in the Italian the food was good and reasonably priced but we thought the wine rather expensive at $7 a glass. We knew breakfast was included but we were very pleasantly surprised by the quality and choice at breakfast which was the best we have come across in the US (when included). We paid $181 for a king-bedded room booked in advance. We have stayed in numerous hotels in Miami for 1 night after arriving by plane and this is definitely the best we have come across and we will definitely stay here again. If like us you are driving on to Sanibel or Captiva or Ft Myers Beach do travel on US 41 as this takes you through the Everglades on a road where there are places you can stop that guarantee close views of alligators and turtles in the wild without spending one extra cent - it's a road we have travelled countless times and it is always a pleasure and a great start to our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for One Night Stay Before Traveling”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFans99
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel after dark and left at sunrise so I didn't see much of it. However, I could tell that the area wasn't the best (not the worst either). The property was secure with a gated garage. You also need a key to operate the elevator. All of this led me to beleive there must be a crime situation in the area. I saw a group of young people roaming the hotel as I was checking out. They looked like they were probabley guests and had partied all night. They were coming from the pool area which should have been closed at that hour. The staff should have told them to keep it down. All in all an okay place to lay your head for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “staff not helpful”
Reviews.Author: a814
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in this hotel because of good reviews from tripadvisor. My family (4 adults) spent a night there prior to our cruise. We asked the front desk staff how to get to downtown Miami by public transit since we wanted to keep our budget low. "Take a cab" was how the staff replied. Okay... maybe it was too difficult for tourists to take the bus, so we asked them to call a cab for us. We waited for 20 mins, no cab showed up. Asked the staff again, they said it takes 45 mins for the cab to come. Suggested us to take free shuttle to airport then take taxi there. Fine. Meanwhile we figured there was a bus stop right outside the hotel which could go to downtown directly. It was not my first time going to curise from Miami, I knew the rate is fixed for taxi from miami airport to port of miami, which is $24. I heard there was shuttle service from the hotel to the port, so I asked how much. They said $10 each. Then I asked how much approx. did it cost to take taxi from hotel to port? The staff said, "oh no, very expensive... not recommended", but she couldn't tell us the cost. She then went to ask another staff, he also said shuttle was cheaper, and trying to help us reserve the shuttle. We kept asking the approx. cost of cab, he finally told us it's about $30-35. Then why would he recommended us to take the shuttle if we have 4 adults??? I think it's the commission they would receive... Not helpful at all! Disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodation but expensive for what it offers.”
Reviews.Author: rafatuma
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel only for one night. Check in was quick and check out too. The breakfast had a good variety and fresh fruits. The room was clean and organized, large bed and good bathroom. Air conditioning running well and without noises. Just found it too simple for the price charged.

Reviews.Title: “For Airport Only”
Reviews.Author: destinawoof
Reviews.Content: Only stay here to sleep, shower and head to the airport. If you want to drive around and sight see this location gets very conjested with traffic. Clean and helpful staff. Average room and bed. Small pool not heated and jacuzzi is green. No restaurant on site. Breakfast is poor quality hot food. Located on a busy 4 lane road. Some restaurants and stores but have to cross very busy road to get there. Shuttle to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: djzook
Reviews.Content: We used the Hampton Inn Blue Lagoon as our stopover in and out of the Florida Keys. This is a great airport hotel, close to the airport with shuttle service every 30 minutes. Accommodations are typical for a renovated Hampton Inn - which is to say it's quite comfortable. Breakfast is included and had hot eggs or omelets, sausage or bacon, waffles, and fresh fruit, along with other cold items. One morning, it did get a bit crowded at breakfast around 9am. The pool area is outdoors - small, but nice. The kids enjoyed a quick dip. Best of all, though, was the service. We had unknowingly left a camera in our room. Within 2 hours of checkout, they had both called and e-mailed me to let us know the camera was left behind. We were able to pick it up before we left the Miami area. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “I am extremely satisfied with the sevice and comfort shown to me at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thallid
Reviews.Content: The people who work here are friendly and very attentive to your needs. Every call includes a "Thank you" and "How can I help". The rooms are clean and comfortable and everything is in good working order.

Reviews.Title: “I can't imagine why this hotel is rated number 2 in Miami”
Reviews.Author: stray
Reviews.Content: It is like any Hampton Inn, I guess. I felt like the room had been assembled from a plastic kit and plopped down in a building. Yes, it seemed clean. However, there was nothing particular nice about the room. Two plastic glasses wrapped in film, tiny bars of soap, a few thin towels, the sheets were ok, and that is about all. I thought the experience there was more like a less expensive property. With all the hotels in Miami, it amazes me that this hotel is rated so highly.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but more suitable for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: starnat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hampton Inn just for one night. Rooms are ok, clean and quiet, staff is nice and breakfast is rich. I think that the hotel is not the more suitable if you want to enjoy Miami as a tourist because it is not so close to places like SoBe. It's good if you need a place near the airport or for a business travel. Places nearby are not interesting at all. Parking is included and this is a good thing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: plays88keys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the night before we went on a cruise, and chose the hotel because of their "Stay and Cruise" package deal. For $189 we got a room (which was upgraded to a suite when we checked in!), a transfer to the cruise port and secure parking for our car while we were away. The port charges $20 a *day* to park, so I'm sure you can immediately see what a value this package is. Add into this the high standards of a Hampton Inn and voila! a perfect choice for this area. My only complaint, and it is a very small one, is that I didn't find the beds as comfortable as I usually do. Nevertheless, I had a decent night's sleep and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Victoria at the front desk is the best employee EVER!”
Reviews.Author: JosephAP
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful cruise and a horrible shuttle experience to the hotel, Victoria went out of her way to get us into our room ASAP and she rescued the remainder of our day. She is an asset to your organization. Thank you again, Victoria!! Kudos!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a standard airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anthony_Forman
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Airport shuttle is fine and the hotel is smart and works well. Small shopping mall over the street where we bought sandwiches etc. Room good. Breakfast fine and staff very helpful. Pool is on 2nd floor so gets you away from traffic. Secure parking is also on this level. Area seems OK.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: wmcjrlee
Reviews.Content: loved the stay and would stay again. very friendly staff. nice clean hotel rooms. great breakfast in the morning. good location.

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Masahisa
Reviews.Content: Nothing special about this hotel. Just an ordinary Hampton Inn, as you can imagine. Room rate was reasonable, so I think it is a good place to stay if you want to avoid over priced Key West hotels. Around the hotel is Cuban neighborhood, so you can find nice Cuban restaurants near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Layover”
Reviews.Author: callieq
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to rest our heads before heading to Costa Rica and back. Service: Shuttle- prompt and on the half hour from MIA airport. Takes 10 min from airport. Front desk: Jeffrey was great! We checked in and out with ease. Very professional and helpful staff. Pool: Didnâ€™t use, but looks nice for a quick dip/ catch some rays. Open 24-7. Gym: Didnâ€™t use, but had the equipment you need for a nice workout. Breakfast: You can grab either the bag breakfast to go or sit upstairs to eat- complementary. Omelet wraps, sausage, juice, waffle maker, pastries, bagels, cereal, coffeeâ€¦etc. Room: Comfy for our 2 nights there and back from Costa Rica. Flat screen TV and very clean. Business Center: 24 hours - printed out plane tickets. Location: Walgreens, CVS, fast food within eye sightâ€¦ delivery menus upon request. Awesome no frills establishment! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Average”
Reviews.Author: ColoKids
Reviews.Content: Honestly, we would probably stay here again due to the pricing and value for the money in this overpriced town. The location may not be the best, but the hotel did hook us up with a local car rental agency that delivered/picked up the car at the hotel. The beds/pillows were certainly not the best. There isn't a restaurant or bar, but there are plenty places in walking distance. Breakfast was enjoyable and better than some hotel continental breakfasts. Didn't leave there hungry, just not restaurant quality. Very close to airport/cruise ships. The staff was very accommodating. The whole hotel clean. Too cold to enjoy the pool as they aren't heated.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: where_am_i_now_11
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on priceline and were very pleasantly surprised. This is a great hotel. Very close to the airport with a quick efficient shuttle. The shuttle will also transport you to local restaurants and there are several just across the street also. Free fast wifi available. They had a very nice complimentary hot breakfast available. The evening cookies hit the spot! The pool and hot tub were really great and loved how it was set up. The public areas were clean and attractive and the staff seemed genuinely happy. Lots of cruise passengers here and many like us who had overnight layovers on international flights. A great airport hotel and a great Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff & hotel”
Reviews.Author: deaglekl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very close to the airport. The rooms are spacious, very clean and well appointed. Rate includes continental breakfast in the hotel, a grab & go breakfast for people making early morning flight departures, free wifi and business center with access to PCs. Staff are very friendly & accomodating. There are pharmacies, fast food and strip mall across the street and on nearby corners. Across the strip in the strip mall is a family run neighbourhood Cuban restaurant - very good, reasonably priced food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Airport -- Good Value”
Reviews.Author: FoxTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights before departing on cruise -- picked hotel based upon reviews and price. Overall good value and shuttle to/from airport was a great conveinance. Hotel id in good shape and the staff is very hospitable and will go out of their way to help. Location is in area with not much dining choices other than Subway, Wendy's, McDonalds, Burger King and a few small places in a strip mall. There is a Publix grocery store across street in case you decide to wine/dine in the room. Overall a good chice for value if staying near airport for flight -- or cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Shor but Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: LAFWilmington_NC
Reviews.Content: We had just returned to tthe USA on a transAtlantic cruise and stayed one day in Miami prior to returning home to NC. The accomodattions and service at the Miami Hampton In n at the Blue Lagoon was wonderful. The staff was friendly and helpful. They provided us with excellent recommendations to see some of Miami sights during our short stay. Additionallty, their airport shuttle provided us round trip transportation to a nearby local restaurant. We also enjoyed the outdoor pool and hot tub as well as the indoor fitness center. The busineesss center provided us wit easy access ta printer to print out our boarding passes. Finally, prior to leaving for the airport we enjoyed a complimentary breakfast. without a doubt, we give this facility an EXCELLENT rating.

Reviews.Title: “Well Deserving of Strong Ratings”
Reviews.Author: pr123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, together with our '20 something' daughter were passing through MIA and needed to stay close to the airport. When my wife and I travel by ourselves we usually stay at the Blue Lagoon Hilton, but wanted a suite rather than booking 2 rooms. Based upon the strong reviews we chose Hampton Inn Blue Lagoon, and our experience supports those reviews. Getting to/from by airport shuttle is easy, and the suite was very comfortable. There is a plaza across the street with several local restaurants. (We loved the cuban restaurant, Casa Juan, for dinner.) There was only 1 person at the front desk when we arrived and there was a bit of a line, but he was very helpful when we got to the counter. I often fly through Miami and have to stay overnight, and value for money this hotel was one of the best. I would certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to spend the night between flights”
Reviews.Author: mmb23
Reviews.Content: I had a very pleasant 1-night stay before flying to Guatemala the next morning. I arrived at midnight and left at 7:30, so it was a short stay, but I appreciated the friendly man at the front desk, the timely and quick shuttle, and the great breakfast. It was included in the rate and there were a ton of great options, a nice start to a long day of travel. The room was clean and surprisingly quiet (since it's so close to the airport) and the bed was comfy. There was a CVS right across the street, and a strip mall, which I didn't use but would have found convenient if I'd forgotten anything, for example. I will definitely return the next time I head to Latin America through Miami and need to spend the night.

Reviews.Title: “Works well if you need to stay by the airport”
Reviews.Author: Parrtohead
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times when we have an early morning flight out of Miami Intl. Airport. It has always been great & the shuttle on time, etc. My only complaint is that we never get to taste the breakfast since we have to be at the airport before they open the breakfast room. They do have To-go snack bags for us early birds, which is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “pre-cruise stay but not sure it should rate #4!”
Reviews.Author: SUPERMOMBX
Reviews.Content: we stayed one night pre-cruise. Because it was rated #4 we had high expectations. Pro's-conveniently located near supermarket, drug stores, and cuban, italian and chinese restaurant. the cuban restaurant was very good. the room was large. had a nice flat screen tv. Con's- bed seemed very old and very soft. very noisy at pool from traffic nearby. Bottom line, it's a hampton inn and it is adequate for a one night stay. I think if in miami, for a cruise I probably would try some place else.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hampton Inn--Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: allen_10030
Reviews.Content: A Hampton Inn with class, great room, wonderful staff, best ever. Right in there with much more expensive hotels. Flor at the desk was over the top. What a great person and so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & service”
Reviews.Author: DubboAussie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night & should have stayed more. Free WiFi & breakfast we welcome

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: HamptonGuest55555
Reviews.Content: Henry in Maintenance saw me having trouble with my key while in the elavator. He walked with me to my room, making sure I could get in. Then, when I couldn't get in, he opened the door for me, and suggested I stop by the front desk to get a new key on my way back out. Five minutes later, he knocked on my door and presented me with a new (working) key. He went way above and beyond to assist me. Its hard to find that type of excellent customer service these days. Thank you Henry!!

Reviews.Title: “Treated Hilton Gold members well! Excellent food and service”
Reviews.Author: bakor
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights before taking a trip to the Caribbean. The service was excellent. The breakfast buffet was quite good and the cookies in the early evening were much appreciated. The second night we were upgraded to a suite -- the best upgrade we've received yet from a Hilton hotel. It was also easy to rent a car and simply return keys to front desk. Thanks for all you do.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice by the airport”
Reviews.Author: tuffy0317
Reviews.Content: My husband stayed here twice during layovers for an international trip over the holidays, arriving in the evening both times. The hotel's public areas are nice and have definitely been taken care of. The check in desk staff was pleasant to deal with. The room was very basic, no frills, but still comfortable. Breakfast both morning's was fine, although I wish they would offer healthier selections - no fruit, and only pastries, sausage, eggs with cheese and waffles. That's disappointing. I also wish they would use something other than Styrofoam plates for breakfast - it's not very "green" considering the steps many other hotels are taking to move in that direction. My biggest complaint would be the pick up process from the airport. The shuttle runs once every 30 minutes on the ticketing level and if you miss it, or it passes you by because it's full (as we did to several international passengers on Christmas evening), you're stuck waiting another 30 minutes. This was frustrating, as other hotels ran their shuttles continuously, allowing for timely pick ups. We waited 40 minutes the first time before being picked up and after waiting 30 minutes the second time, finally took a taxi to the hotel. The airport drop off service was fine, but the pick up service was really bad. There has to be a better way to do it, especially when one shuttle was always sitting idle at the hotel. This is almost a deal breaker for me when choosing an airport hotel next time. The last thing I want to do after sitting on a plane for two hours is wait outside for a hotel shuttle. A side recommendation: the Cuban restaurant in the shopping center across from the hotel is awesome. Great food, good hours, friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superior service with a smile... what a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: packanack
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel close to the airport as we were in-transit for a couple of days before heading home. I'd stayed at other MIA hotels, and was never 100% satisfied so decided to try Hampton Inn this time. Great choice. I had requested a room with a refrigerator for medication, and when we checked in, the room we were booked for didn't have one but the young lady at the Front Desk sorted this out immediately and upgraded us to a Jr. Suite without hesitation. Throughout our stay this young lady (with long blonde hair) was extremely helpful and friendly - going out of her way to be of assistance with anything we wanted or needed. The other hotel staff were equally accommodating and made our short stay very pleasant. The room was very comfortable and clean. The breakfast was a bit crowded at times and we had to wait a little before finding seats, but overall it was pretty good - especially for being a 'free' breakfast. All in all the Hampton Inn Blue Lagoon was the best airport hotel in the Miami area - very reasonably priced, clean, comfortable and with outstanding staff and service. I'd recommend to anyone transiting Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice by airport”
Reviews.Author: bestillfamily
Reviews.Content: We needed a close location to the airport for connecting flights, and a good sleep after some overnight flights. The shuttle service was excellent! Front desk staff and breakfast room staff were very cheery. Our room was just fine - except for the sluggish toilet, which a gentleman came and fixed in moments. If travelling through Miami again, we'd definitely choose this Hampton because of the caring staff and prime location.

Reviews.Title: “Close to ships, great sleep, spotless, and wonderful staff...we will return”
Reviews.Author: GoGoGirl35
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in we were treated very well. We were greeted with a friendly smile and the gent who checked us in, inquired as to the reason for our stay. We explained we would be leaving on a cruise the following day to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. He congratulated us and then very unexpectedly upgraded our room to a lovely one bedroom suite with a view of the lagoon, and we were able to watch the planes come and go all day. That was such a nice surprise and we certainly appreciated the gesture. He also gave us a complimentary pass for the shuttle to the pier the next morning. We loved our stay at Hampton Suites...the hotel was spotless and all the staff we saw and spoke with greeted us with smiles. Should we ever need a place to stay while in Miami again we will definitely return to The Hampton Inn & Suites on the lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “The bed was like sleeping on a marshmallow”
Reviews.Author: zorka3500
Reviews.Content: Great location, just by the airport. The room was quiet, clean but in need of much improvement. For $160 a night, I was expecting a newer bed. the mattress should of been replaced about five years prior. It was like sleeping on a mashmallow. As soon as your partner moved, you'd wake up. Awful. The sheets were nice though, very soft. I suspect they were just as old as the mattress... a scary thought. Secured parking, free breakfast, if you're sleeping alone, stay here, if not, find a more comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: dlspivey
Reviews.Content: I have never been disapointed, the staff is always very friendly and the rooms are always clean and comfortable. My first choice when staying in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Marginal at best . . .”
Reviews.Author: cqrt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business meeting in the area after flying into Ft. Lauderdale - - easy to find, but nothing close but fast food restaurants. Facility is older, dated and although reasonably clean, you had the sense you might be in the wrong part of town. Rooms were just okay but need a thorough cleaning and updating. Breakfast was marginal- but nice to have included - - coffee and juice are really all a traveler needs. Cheaper than the nearby Hilton - -but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: dumoyer2
Reviews.Content: Rates: Reasonable and discounts for triple A, AARP etc. Reception on arrival: Friendly, efficient. Our reception guy really put us in a good mood right away (Ricardo). Room: Nothing special but met all of our needs for the purpose of our stay Ammenities: Most important, free airport transportation. Inexpensive shuttle to cruise ships Free internet, pretty good free breakfast (hot food), pool, hot tub and fitness center Location: A couple of strip malls with a Publix market, Walgreens, CVS pharmacy and some ok restaurants. It's not what you'd call a charming location but it's sure cheaper than a hotel on South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “The best staff of any Hampton Inn I have stayed at this year!”
Reviews.Author: Betsy39W_10
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn Blue Lagoon MIami Airport is my hotel choice when traveling to Florida. Whether it be getting directions for a 5 mile run, mapping out the closest Dunkin Donuts, or helping out when the guests next door to my room started a party at 4am, assistant manager Jeffrey and his staff are the best!!! I will continue to recommend and stay at this property whenever in the area :) Thank you! Betsy

Reviews.Title: “Probably would not stay there again!!!”
Reviews.Author: AimeeB89
Reviews.Content: My family, husband daughter and I as well as my mother in law and mom stayed pre-cruise and post cruise on November 13th and November 21st. When I made the reservation back in August, I emailed a gal by the name of Christina who put in the request for adjoining rooms both times as well as an early check in on November 21st. She said she would do her best. When we arrived at the hotel on the 13th we were given two separate rooms across the hall and down from each other. It made it somewhat difficult for my daughter to go back and forth from our room to her grandmas' room. We dealt with it and hoped that on our return we would get adjoining rooms, which we did not. We were assigned the very same rooms on a different floor as on the 13th. I was very frustrated and maybe the hotel does not know what adjoining rooms are. I assume that they are rooms that have an adjoining door in between them where we can go back and forth using the adjoining door, rather than the hallway. We also had a nightmare with the shuttle service that was to take us to the port but that is not the hotels fault , it was the gal who was calling out the cruise lines and skipped Royal Caribbean and left about 5 of us families behind because they did not want to unload all of the luggage and start over. She did arrange for another van to come and pick us up but most of the people got their money back and took a cab which we should have done. We had signed up for the noon pick up and finally left the hotel at 12:50PM. I sure hope this doesn't happen often but honestly I would take a cab next time since it's about the same price and you get there faster and easier, rather than going with 100 other people at one time. As far as the hotel it was a little bit dirty in the bathrooms. It doesn't appear that the floors had been vacuumed or moped as there was hairs all over the floors. I thought maybe it was just a fluke but it was like that on the 2nd night we stayed as well. It was a little gross so I was sure to wear my flip flops around the whole time. The breakfast was decent but it was very crowded due to all the cruise passengers. I would probably stay somewhere else next time due to the fact that they couldn't accommodate us either time by having adjoining rooms even though I made my reservation well in advance as well as having the bathroom not very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay and visit while seeing the sights in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: SYMESZOO
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and nicely upkept. The room was nice and spacious. The complementary breakfast in the morning was great! I loved the free internet access for guests as well. Great location and very close to the airport. Good for travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Pre-Cruise Option”
Reviews.Author: SCSTravelJunkie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the night before a cruise out of Miami. We used the free shuttle from the airport. Finding the shuttle area was a bit complicated but we had no wait. Just make sure you board the Hampton van that has 777 on the front. There are multiple Hamptons in the area. At check-in we were upgraded to a suite. Very nice customer service. The suite had a king bed in a separate bedroom, nice bath, typical living area (couch, chair, tv) and a full kitchen (full size fridge, microwave, stove top, dishwasher) as well as plenty of cooking utensils, cookware and about anything else you'd need for an extended stay. The property is located across the street from a strip mall that has a Publix (grocery store), liquor store and several small restaurants. If you're looking for authentic Cuban food, we highly recommend Casa Juan. The waitstaff will help you interpret the menu, as will most of the many locals who dine there. The street you cross is six lanes - a bit like playing Frogger - but there is a crosswalk and a light at the corner. We booked early and secured our room for $89 with a AAA discount. By the week before the cruise, the same room was at $169. Breakfast was quite nice, hot and cold fare, but very crowded. Even the tables outside were full up with people looking for a place to sit. We offered to share our table and had a great time getting to know a couple from Portugal. We opted for a cab to the port ($30 with tip) instead of the shuttle. The shuttle was $10pp but didn't start running until 11:00am. The property decor is typical Floridian fare and is starting to show it's age. However, it was very clean and the service impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Schneider's LAM logistic team had a very good experience in Hampton Inn Miami.”
Reviews.Author: TPilipov
Reviews.Content: I had a meeting for 3 days with the logistics team in Hampton Inn Miami, we used the board room for the one day training and the other 2 days meetings. The room was very comfortable, we had a nice coffebreak for the 3 days, the room was very comfortable table apart with a nice structure and a good air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service provided by all staff members.”
Reviews.Author: faethh
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the Hampton Inn & Suites at the airport was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely return and are looking forward to our next visit. Whenever we fly out of Miami we will use the Hampton Inn and the free parking. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Baseball85
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn was so comfortable and quiet. It was perfect, including location. We definitely will be back on our next trip to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great night at Hampton Inn and Suites”
Reviews.Author: Salinejack
Reviews.Content: Not knowing where to stay for one night in Miami, we selected the Hampton Inn and Suites, Miami Airport South, due to the availability of the free shuttle from the airport to the hotel. We were greeted courteously and promptly at the desk, and were greatly surprised when the person checking us in said he was going to upgrade us to a suite. We were assigned a suite on the top floor in the corner, with a great view of the airport and surrounding area. The next morning we took advantage of the free breakfast buffet, and then shopped for some last minute items for our cruise at the mall across the street. We then went on to the port via a shuttle that was booked through the hotel. We were very happy with the quality of the service in all aspects of our stay, and the reasonable price we paid. We would highly recommend this property to others.

Reviews.Title: “Hassle Free Stay”
Reviews.Author: Domrcpl
Reviews.Content: 90% of the time, I stay at Hilton properties, including at Hampton Inns so I know what I like and what to expect. The Hampton Inn & Suites at Miami Airport did not disappoint. It is very conveniently located close to the airport. All the staff I encountered were professional and helpful I made a mistake with using the safety deposit box in my room but had no trouble getting prompt assistance. Storing luggage due to my late departure was not a hassle. It was also reassuring that the hotel appeared to take customer safety and security seriously with their highly visible personnel. Overall I had a very pleasant stay and would recommend the place.

Reviews.Title: “Easily meets the high quality of the Hampton Inns.”
Reviews.Author: txstork
Reviews.Content: We have within the past several years chosen Hampton Inns as our residence of choice. We have always found them to be easily accessible, clean, well appointed, and a good value for the price. The staff at each hotel has always been courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: epozner
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite Hampton in the Miami area... safe, clean and friendly. Good breakfast choices too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent efficient and friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: chings022
Reviews.Content: Your receptionist Flor helped to get us settled after a tiring trip. We arrived before check-in time but she was able to locate a wonderful up-graded room for us right away. She was very knowledgeable about restaurants in the area and called a cab for us to have a great seafood meal. Like Flor, your airport shuttle van driver was very friendly and helpful with advice. He told us how enjoyed a visit to our home state, Hawaii, last year. We enjoyed our stay immensely.

Reviews.Title: “Dark, Dank, Dunk...”
Reviews.Author: meh2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not what it is billed to be according to the reviews it somehow recieved from teh reviewers here on trip advisor. It is maybe 2 stars AAA rating, but definitely not 3 stars! For those who think this may be an upscale hotel, please do not be fooled. The room that I was to stay in was dark, in a shady neighborhood, had furnishings sufficient for a 1970Â´s motor inn, not a hotel in the year 2010. When I commented this to the staff, they did try to re-accomodate us in another room, but still it was a cheesey room at best and they did not charge me for the stay. Its proximity to the Miami airport is good, but really, if you must stay in the neigborhood, choose the other side of the road near where the Sofitel is located as it is much more peaceful and does have more vegetation present making it a better value for a stay. As well it appears to be a safer area than where the Hampton Inn concrete jungle area is located.

Reviews.Title: “The housekeeping staff left me wanting much much more.”
Reviews.Author: pt320
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on multiple occasions and the stay went from great to ridiculous. My first stay was fine. I had a view of Miami International Airport, and it was very lovely to look at at night. On my 2nd visit, I noticed that my room just wasn't being cleaned. The bed was made, and it appeared to have been "cleaned", but I noticed my hair (which unfortunately falls often) wasn't just pushed around. One day, I returned to my room and noticed the trash had been bagged and left on top of my bathroom counter. Needless to say, that soured my impression of the hotel. The third time I stayed there (it was close to work), I went to my room and found that there were bags left behind by a previous guest. They had been shoved behind the armchair. I immediately went downstairs to request a new room and was given one. The new room was fine, except for the fact that when I reached for a towel after my shower, I noticed someone else's curly hair (it was black, mine is red/gold and straight) was in my towel. I was so highly turned off that I almost had to leave. Moving on to the front desk staff: The front desk staff was very helpful and accomodating when I reported my issues, BUT, I have to point out something that irked me. There was one gentleman named Rodney (there are actually 2 guys named Rodney that work there) who was wearing a jacket which had a huge rip in the elbow. As pleasant as he was, it was unprofessional and distracting, and I even pointed it out to him (although how he could have missed it was beyond me.) He shrugged it off saying, "yeah, I know" and smiled at me. On a scale of 1-5, the front desk would get a 3 from me and the housekeeping staff would get a 0. Oh and how could I forget...this part still puzzles me. I don't know if it's a good thing or a bad thing, but the parking is gated and you have to swipe your room key in order to access the garage. You also have to swipe in the elevator if you want to get to the guest rooms (floors 3 and up.) I spent about 5 minutes in the elevator trying to figure out how to get upstairs the first time I went there, and after that, I spent a few different occasions explaining it to other guests. It's good because it means no strange characters can enter but at the same time, it's a little scary that they even had to put those types of barriers in place. I have already made my dissatisfaction known to the hotel management and made them aware of the issues, and they have implemented the 100% Satisfaction Guarantee and credited me for one night of my stay (which really didn't mean much, but I guess it's better than the alternative.) Overall, I wouldn't stay here again unless I had no other choice. I know that my experiences aren't necessarily the norm, but they've definitely shaped my opinion of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: edu_cavalcanti
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel! Would stay there again! Reasonable rates, good service, comfortable room (bed and pillows are very nice), good internet access and parking, both for free. Location is also a plus (close to the airport, only about 10 minutes to downtown and with several restaurant/fast food options in the area).

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Friendly, Curtious Staff!”
Reviews.Author: aussieterrierlovers
Reviews.Content: We arrived after our cruise at the hotel early, 10:00 AM. We were greated by Flo at the front desk. Her warm smile made us feel very welcome. Our room was available right away and we found it very clean & neat. She assisted us by making a day tour reservation so that we could see a little of what Miami was all about. The tour was terrific and made our day go so quickly. Once back, the shuttle took us over to the 94th Squadron Restaurant which was suggested by Flo and Jonathon. The dinner was great, my bourbon ribs fell off the bone and were delicious. Once dinner was finished, we called the hotel to be picked up. This is a very nice extra as we did not have a rental car. We definately would recommend to others and would stay again ourselves at this Hampton Inn & Suites. The staff was most friendly, very helpful and curtious in making sure all our needs were met. We look forward to staying again and felt very secure in the surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ShafALondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Miami for two nights on route to Orlando. The hotel location was perfect after a late night flight into Miami Airport. The staff were very helpfull. Breakfast was basic but just what we needed for an early morning start. Rooms were of a reasonable size and clean. The main thing that stood out was the level of service provided by the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing deal”
Reviews.Author: bncav
Reviews.Content: The nights spent at this hotel were very well valued, considering cost/benefit ratio. At first, we realized that the safe box in our room was not working. I called the front desk and they sent someone to check it almost immediately. The maintenance guy could not solve the problem and they gave us another room (with a working safe box). The staff was very attentious (although the room change was a little bit slow to process) and friendly. Breakfast is very good, mainly considering that it is complimentary. I would only consider the location a downside, since I have chosen the hotel as a base for sightseeing and shopping. It is about 5-6 miles from most of the attractions and good restaurants in Miami, and the neighborhood where it is located is far from what we can consider "the best" (although I still do not know an hotel close to an airport located in a first class neighborhood). Summing up, very good value in a quite new and clean hotel with nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: abfgbg310
Reviews.Content: When we checked in, the desk clerk we had, I'm sorry I do not remember his name (a young black ameican), wa very nice. Because we had to wait a long time for the shuttle, he apologized and offered to upgrade our room at no charge for the inconvenience.He was very courteous and customer oriented. We enjoyed our pre cruise stay and will plan to stay at your hotel on future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hampton Inn I've stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: mmayes_onthego
Reviews.Content: Flew into Miami airport. Hotel Shuttle bus was there immediately. Check-in was quick. Staff was polite. Room was perfect. No strange odors. Complimentary breakfast was excellent with lots of selections. Definitely best Hampton Inn I've stayed at (and I've stayed at quite a few).
