Maybe because the hotel is so very busy our room was showing a lot of wear & tear & looked ready for an early upgrade and some TLC Bedding was seriously in need of replacement - our duvet consisted of clumps of fill with empty spaces between them [washed at wrong setting or ?], pillow cases hadn't been pressed & one had yellow stains, and the decorative pillow was grubby & frayed... Front desk instantly replaced the stained pillowcase - they're great ! - but couple the state of the linens with a carpet in need of shampooing & whole room looked tired & worn Housekeeper didn't speak any English - apparently this isn't uncommon in Miami but as first time visitors we were suprised - and since our Spanish is minimal it made communication a bit difficult. Would we stay there again ? Sure, its a Hampton & the bed's comfortable [we dumped the dead duvet & used a blanket], showers are good & breakfast was excellent - and by the time we go back hopefuly they'll have renovated....

Reviews.Title: “Attentive and Professional Service...First Rate Hotel...Clean and Comfy Everywhere”
Reviews.Author: jkapmiami
Reviews.Content: My family just stayed in this hotel in order to save money in a location "off the beach". We were pleasantly surprised by the look and feel of the hotel's interior. It has open and comfortable common areas with a grand staircase leading from the lobby to the 2nd level where the gym, meeting room, and dining room is located. The pool area is large with a heated pool and hot tub. You can also watch the planes landing and taking off at the airport if you have a northern view. We did not hear the planes from the rooms so the windows must be sound proofed. The rooms felt brand new and the bedding was great. The staff was extremely professional and very pleasant. The location turned out to be a plus because we did not have to deal with "beach traffic". We have 3 kids so we stayed in a suite with a kitchen and a living room with a pull out couch. The staff brought in a small crib and roll away bed to make sure each child had a comfortable stay. Very impressive. The hot breakfast items were different each day (5 days) we were there and there was always fresh fruit and coffee available throughout the day. There are 3 computers for your use which we used to print our boarding passes prior to our return flight. There is also a small "store" that sold commonly used toiletries, drinks, and snacks. I would definetely recommend this hotel to anyone that is on a budget and does not mind driving 10-15 minutes to the beach. It is a well managed and enjoyable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: zimmdj
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on the reviews posted and agree with all the good posts. We stayed her before our cruise, coming into Miami on a Friday night and leaving on Saturday for the cruise. The airport pickup worked out great, didn't have to wait too long at all. The room was spacious and clean and just perfect for the night/next am. The kids went to the pool early and we really enjoyed it, had the place to ourselves. Breakfast was very good and very well attended. No problem getting a cab to the port either....for a family of 4 this was the least expensive way to go. If ever in Miami, I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Professional and understanding front desk personnel”
Reviews.Author: Hollywood52
Reviews.Content: I was a confirmed quest whose business and travel plans changed at the last moment, but the staff were understanding and accommodating when I was forced to cancel the reservation. In addition, a very important document was sent via courier to the hotel for me to recieve, and after a phone call to explain, the front desk attendant, namely Rodney Rodriquez, recieved the package on my behalf, stored it until I could get to the hotel to pick it up, and would not take anything for his time and efforts. This kind of employee is rare and a real asset to your establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: cruisinglibrarian
Reviews.Content: We recenty stayed here before our 7 day Caribbean cruise (March 14-21) leaving from the port of Miami. We flew in the day prior to the cruise (Friday) and got the free hotel shuttle from the airport. We didn't have to wait long and the driver was very friendly and attentive. Check-in at the hotel was fast and easy, and we were able to sign up for the shuttle to the port of Miami on Saturday at check-in time. Our room was clean and very nice, and we had a nice view of Blue Lagoon and Miami airport. Once we were settled, we walked across the street to the shopping center and various fast food places. We got a few last minute items at Walgreens and headed back to the hotel where we sat by the pool. For dinner, we went to Pollo Tropical which is a block from the hotel. The food there was good and not too expensive. There is a Publix supermarket in the shopping center if a person wanted to get food and bring back to the hotel. The next morning we had the free continental breakfast at the hotel and enjoyed it very much. Good selections and quite plentiful. We also liked the fruit, cookies, and hot beverages available throughout the day and evening. Transport to the port went smoothly and only cost us $10 per person (company not affiliated with the hotel). All in all, it was a very good experience and we would stay there again if cruising from Miami. Good value for the money and excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - could not be better”
Reviews.Author: martyngs
Reviews.Content: Brilliant in every way! Free airport shuttle every half-hour, attentive and helpful staff, super room, free business centre (plus in room wi-fi), included breakfast. We had two one-night stays en route to and from Central America. On our second stay we had even been given the room which on our outward trip my wife had suggested would be slightly better. On our return, we had time to spare, so the fitness centre and the guest laundry were both very useful. The shopping mall acraoss the street has a supermarket, three restaurants and two 24-hr drugstores as well as several other shops. In addition there are three fast food places and 300yds down the road, another smarter restaurant - although we didn't get to eat there,

Reviews.Title: “Just an ok stopover place”
Reviews.Author: screamlikehowarddean
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and used this place to layover before our cruise. It was about an hour wait for the free shuttle to come. The hotel is next to some fast food places and a strip mall, so shopping for pre-cruise items was a snap. There's a $10 PP shuttle fee to the ship port (in a van with 8 other people), which is way too much because it was only a $25 cab ride. We just shared a cab. The hotel itself was ok, definitely not new. the room had 2 queen beds, the carpet had seen better days. Breakfast in the am was below Hampton standards I thought. The pool was small but fine, the whirlpool was broken. The workout room was decent, but didn't have any treadmills, and some of the weight machines were broken. There was nothing going on near the place after dark, and I don't think I'd venture out to far to look around. All in all, if I had to do it again I'd just take a cab straight from the airport to a hotel by the port and stay overnight there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for airport stop over or pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: dannydodger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after flying in from LHR for 1 night before a cruise. Arrived at Miami airport at 18:00, its a busy airport so was a bit of a battle to get outside to try and find the hotels free bus (its on the upper level outside departures, not arrivals) once you get to the bus stops its a case of keeping ur eyes peeling and running when you see it pull up, not ideal but thats the airports fault not the Hampton inns, we only ended up waiting around 10mins, then a quick 100m dash, so wasnt to bad really.The trip to the hotel only takes 10min. Check in was quick and easy, the guy was very helpful, and get this, they had a promo on, some "gas promo" so when we checked in they gave me $10 cash, not much, but its the first time a hotel has put cash in my hand at check-in!! Our room was high up on the 11th floor, as id requested,and overlooked the airport, as i requested. The room was a good size, a little dated perhaps, but very clean and comfortable, we had a nice view over blue lagoon and onto MIA. They hotel as no food options so we wondered across the street for a McDonalds (after 11hours travelling, just needed a quick snack, not a full meal) there are a few food options around that you can walk to, or the hotel bus driver is happy to take you somwhere locally, nice touch!! It was dark when we went out and the area felt safe enough, I would not hesitate in walking around alone. After a good nights sleep we headed down for the comp breakfast, there wasnt a huge choice but plenty to suit most and its was free so happy with that. Before we checked out we used the business centre to print some things and check emails, a nice feature, again it costs nothing, it can be found next to reception. We got the hotel to book us a space on there shuttle to the port - its not a hotel bus hence why they dont advertise it on the website, but for $10 each its good value, they have 3 a day 11,12,13:00, best to book when you check in, the trip only take 20min to the port. We booked thru the hotel website, as a hhonours member we got triple points, we paid $139, which compared to other hotels in the area was very good!! There a few other options within 100m of the hotel, Sofitel,Hilton,Hyatt Place, but if you can get a decent rate i would stay here-the others tend cost a fair bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: rc218
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a night before our cruise. The staff was great. They answered all our questions and were very helpful. The bed was comfortable and it was nice to have breakfast included. There was a CVS and Walgreens within walking distance for those things you might have forgotten to pack. Overall, a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very Clean and comfortable hotel. The breakfast was great, the room was great and the location worked for me. Close to airport, Miami Children's Hospital and local businesses. Workout room was well kept and clean. Pool looked nice and staff was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tuba4
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at this hotel while attending the NCAA National Championship Game. This hotel was priced much lower than other hotels for this time period. The hotel was clean, comfortable and secure (key required for elevator). It is very near the airport and has its own shuttle. We rented a car to get us to the game but the hotel arranged a special shuttle for guests traveling to the game which allowed us to turn our rental car in early. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast was nothing special but it was included. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and facility”
Reviews.Author: mnreviewer
Reviews.Content: Facility is very clean. The room was very roomy and well kept. House service and reception was extremely responsive. Security is managed versus for show like other hotels. Price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “100% Satisfied! Will absolutely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: tpascal
Reviews.Content: After a long flight, (we came from Edmonton, Alberta, Canada), we arrived at the Hampton Inn & Suites - Maimi Airport on Jan. 2 as a stop over before boarding our cruise the next day. I had just recently signed up for Hilton Hotels Rewards and decided to try one the hotels suggested through the Hilton rewards program. We choose Hampton Inn & Suites, Miami Airport as the price was right which included a continental breakfast and had shuttles to the airport and ports. Plus, I checked out some of the reviews on Trip Advisor and was satisfied that this was a place we could try. We were totally pleased with the service! First of all, the shuttle picked us up within 15-20 mintues of calling them from the airport. Our check-in was smooth and quick, our room was clean, the beds were super comfortable. They had a business office that we could use to check emails, surf the net, etc., at no extra cost. The staff super friendly and helpful, and best of all, they had great security, we felt very safe. The most AMAZING thing was the Honesty of their staff, totally outstanding!!!! ..--- This is what happened......my 13 year old son had been saving his money all year and after exchanging some of his canadian money he was exicted to have american money. Anyways to make a long story short, the next day we checked out at around noon, we had the hotel book a shuttle to take us to the port. We arrived at the port, registered and got on our ship. It wasn't until a few hours later that my son realized he had left his envelope with $120.00 (U.S) at our hotel room at the Hampton Inn & Suites. At this point my son is in tears, this was almost of all his money with the exception of what he had in his pocket. I immediately called the hotel to see if anyone found the envelope. I was told that the chamber maid who cleaned our room had already turned in the envelope and that the hotel had emailed us and called our home number and left a message of their findings! I told them that we were already on the cruise ship and that the ship was about to dock and that it was impossible for us to retrieve the envelope until the following week. The manager (Victoria, I believe) said no problem, that she would lock up the envelope till we get back there. Well, when we returned on Jan. 10, Victoria was on duty and immediately returned the envelope, needless to say, my son was grateful. I was grateful, and gave Victoria $20.00 to give to the chambermaid who turned in the envelope as her reward. It is so great to see such honesty and to know that there are honest people out there. Way to Go Hampton Inn & Suites, you made our stay the very best, we'll definately stay there again! Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre-Cruise--Hampton Blue Lagoon Exceeded Our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: cinsea
Reviews.Content: When you're in need of a pre-cruise hotel, at times just searching can be a nightmare and I research everything. I'm a member of an extremely popular cruise review board where people join to do just about nothing but research. When I booked our cruise, I also made a pre-cruise hotel reservation at another hotel and I held that reservation for the better part of a year. The hotel, which we previously stayed at, didn't offer a complimentary breakfast or a shuttle from the airport or to the port. The advantage, it's in the Bayside Marketplace area, making it convenient to shopping and dining without the need for a taxi. This time, I couldn't get past the lack of other ammenities and began a search for another hotel. When I found the Hampton Blue Lagoon, I was so thrilled. Reviews on the cruise boards were positive. One negative to us would be it's close to the airport and not to the port, but the Hampton still offered convenient shopping and dining without taxi, and the bonus of a complimentary breakfast and shuttle from the airport . They also offered a independent shuttle to the port for $10 a person, and for two, that was still a bargain. I made a new reservation! Booking on the site was easy. Getting the complimentary airport shuttle once in Miami, was a negative. I personally blame Miami Airport for that. The hotel told us what # to call, but the usual direct hotel phone bank was not in site. Even the airport employees were not able to help....??? I carry my confirmation, so I called the hotel directly. We waited no more than 15 minutes and the shuttle was there. Their very friendly shutter driver took care of us! (He worked on Sunday am too, so I'm sure you'd run into him.) Just across the street has a publix, liquor store and restaurants and Walgreens was just a block away. Absolutely everything was within walking distance, and a taxi only needed if you can't walk. The shuttle driver said they'd drive us no charge to the (94th Aero Squadron Restaurant good food and view of plane takeoff and landing)...10 min + safe walk with sidewalk even available.... The airport noise was not an issue at all! King room was as expected, good. You need a room key to get past the 2nd floor, excellent safety!! Pool was nice looking but we didn't use. Complimentary breakfast very good, with alot of choices. Check in-out was a breeze, and the shuttle [independent company] picked us up on time and for $10 a person was all we needed. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Thank you Hampton Blue Lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “above average”
Reviews.Author: Grec
Reviews.Content: We spent a week over New Year at the Hampton Inn. Initially we thought of staying in Miami Beach but found the hotel rates there too high. All in all the Hampton Inn wasnâ€™t a bad choice considering that we undertook some out-of-town trips in several directions. The drive to Miami Beach takes about 20 minutes. The hotel is quite convenient for heading south (Key West) or north (Fort Lauderdale). The staff was really friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is good and there is also some space along the pool for enjoying breakfast open air. The room was spacious and clean, the amenities good (wireless internet, coffee maker, TV, etc.), the beds very comfy, and the windows almost completely soundproof. The only (little) trouble we had was with the bathroom, which didnâ€™t have a tub and was regularly flooded after only one shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elmer&Lizette
Reviews.Content: Do not hesitate to book this hotel if you need a hotelroom close to the airport. We got a good deal on a good, clean and quiet hotelroom. Good service & a nice breakfast. If you have an early flight they will give you a breakfast-bag.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Miami”
Reviews.Author: dg1812
Reviews.Content: I 've just returned from an excellent stay at the Hampton Inn and Suites. I stayed there based on the excellent Trip Advisor reviews of this hotel, I was not disappointed. The hotel was really great, the staff are friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel was extremely clean and very well run. The room was spacious, comfortable and quiet. The carpark is secure, the breakast room is very well supplied and constantly maintained to a very high standard by the staff. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone, I really enjoyed my stay at Hampton Inn and Suites Miami airport. A big thank you to all the staff at the hotel for making my stay such an enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Great, convenient stopping point”
Reviews.Author: ndl001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night, pre-cruise. It was a great option as indicated by many reviewers. Lovely lobby, breakfast area and pool. Fast check-in and extremely nice rooms with very comfortable beds; free internet access. Newer hotel that is very well maintained by the staff. Restaurants and convenience/grocery stores located within walking distance across the street from the hotel (cuban was very good and unique for those not from Miami). Took advantage of hearty breakfast option dining outside by the pool. Hotel also offers shuttle services for $10 per person to the port of miami to connect with cruise ships. Select from three times (11, 12, or 1) for port transport. Took the 12 PM shuttle for our cruise and were on board the ship by 1. They really should actively promote this service on their web site! Room rate seems a hint high, but worth it for all the ease it provided and took out all hassles of transiting Miami... highly recommend for anyone needing a great place for a stop over in MIA! Appreciated airport transportation, although it took some time and calls to the hotel due to the high volume of guest pick ups at around 7 PM upon our arrival at MIA.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.....”
Reviews.Author: DelinaJ
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a three night stay at the Hampton. Well what can i say it's no Hilton but it's not far. The service is excellent and the rooms are spacious and clean. I went with my three year old son who was super excited about the unlimited drinks and snacks on offer 24hrs in adittion to the lovely bagels and fruit selection at breakfast. The hotels staff are very friendly and accomodating. The hotel is across the street from 24hr stores, food joints and a mini shopping area. It is also close to the main malls, and international airport , which made the location perfect for our Miami shopping experience. I would advise anyone to go to the Hampton and i will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value; below average location”
Reviews.Author: kands6191
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights pre-cruise. Very nice room. Great free breakfast and coffee service. Didn't use pool but it seemed nice. Business office offered free internet access which was very helpful. There was a small pantry selling snacks at absolutely ridiculous prices. Only reason to use the pantry would be to avoid leaving the grounds of the hotel. The surrounding area is pretty run down. There are no restaurants except a few fast food places. I didn't feel very safe in the area, especially at night. The hotel has gated parking that you need a room key to access. It seemed fairly secure, but I can see how someone with bad intentions could easily hop the fence and break into a car and then throw the stolen goods back over the fence. I noticed that the door at the back of the hotel near the eating area that is locked at night (need room key to open) got stuck open a couple of times when we were going through it with our bags. We had to put down our stuff and pull it shut. If you didn't realize that it wasn't going to close behind you, it could end up being open all night long. If someone wanted to jump the fence and access the hotel this way it would be easy. I appreciate the manager's response on this site, but I do have to say I am disturbed by the guest's report of a poor response from the hotel. That would be a very traumatic thing to have happen. If the break-in wasn't discovered until 7:30 AM, it shows the security guard wasn't patrolling the grounds at all. Knowing the neighborhood that this hotel is in and the lack of effort from the security guard and poor response from the hotel to the other guest's break-in, I have to say I won't stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Go to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kateharmond
Reviews.Content: This is a real gem of a hotel - great staff, nice pool area, free wi-fi and very close to convenience stores. They even offer free airport transfers and include a good breakfast. Excellent for business or leisure travel, and very safe for lone female visitors.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: bossarmani
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at this hotel for 2 days and couldnt wait to come home to write my brief own personal review. 1- nice location 2- secure parking 3- excellent staff 4- amazing breakfast 5- HONEST WORKERS that can be trusted. 6- beautiful hotel If you want to know more email me . Stay there if you go to miami , you cant go wrong. Eric and Joanna

Reviews.Title: “just fine”
Reviews.Author: kevinVictoriaBc
Reviews.Content: After checking out tripadvisor reviews I thought this hotel would work for one night for a morning flight home. I arrived at MIA in the evening, asked someone where to get hotel shuttles, easily found it in about 5 mins, only passenger, had a breeze checking in, checked email, printed boarding pass, nice people, nice room for the price, crashed, woke up, adequate brekkie, easy shuttle to airport. Absolutely no complaints. Very good airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a secure location; beware”
Reviews.Author: midgatraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before leaving a cruise because we were told they had secure, gated parking. One of the families in our party parked in their "secure" garage only to discover the morning of departure that their vehicle window had been smashed and all of their belongings (including their luggage) had been stolen during the night. Upon investigation we discovered that the "fence" securing the parking deck had holes in it and had been poorly mended. So much for secure parking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hampton”
Reviews.Author: qarliv
Reviews.Content: Although I always liked to stay at Hampton, this one was surprisingly excellent. Outside it looks just fine. The lobby is nice with free Internet and computer access in a business room near the lobby. It even has a printer. The staff was very helpful. I shipped several packages to this hotel and everything was delivered to me in time without any mistakes. The management is also great by following all my instruction exactly. The breakfast is good with the possibility to take away. The room is large with a small kitchen that is very convenient and a living room. There is room to organize your luggage before your flight. I highly recommend this hotel for an airport stay. There is even a supermarket just across the street and 3 restaurants - Italian, Chinese and Burger King. The neighborhood on the other hand is not for walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hampton Inn we've seen!”
Reviews.Author: JHarrington
Reviews.Content: First, I should say, the Hampton Inn is not a luxury hotel - it is a good basic chain hotel with basic amenities. That being said, my husband and I were treated betterat this Hampton Inn than we have been at $1200/nt hotels elsewhere. We stayed at this hotel for the reason many others do - a pre-cruise night in Miami. We arrived early in the day, to accomodate a visit to Miami Beach to eat at a restaurant we'd been wanting to get to. Upon arrival, our room was immediately available (although it was before check in time). We had a lovely room on a higher floor, with a view of nothing in particular, but that was OK with us. Although it was in close proximity to the airport, there was no airport noise that we noticed. The gentleman at the front desk offered the use of the shuttle, although we had a vehicle so we didn't need it. He also shared info about some local restaurants, and was in general very accomodating and friendly. We felt very welcome at this hotel. Bed was very comfy - room was very clean. Check out was a breeze, and breakfast was great. I had my 'norm' - fruit and yogurt, but my husband partook in the hot breakfast of the day, which was an open faced bagel sandwich. He said it was much better than he'd expected, given that it was sitting in a chafing dish. I'd highly recommend for a pre-cruise night, or even a visit to Miami, as long as you don't mind being 'away from the action' a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Met all our needs!”
Reviews.Author: jrose8140
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a post-cruise night before a flight the next day. The hotel was conveniently located with a Walgreens just across the road and a Wendy's about a block away. Nice Hampton Inn rooms with the curved shower bar is nice. Secured parking lot and elevators. The hot tub was not hot during out night stay, but the pool area was nice. The staff were extremely helpful with locations, maps, weather and flight information. The shuttle begins at 5:00am to the airport, but since our flight was at 6:00am we asked for a taxi pickup at 4:30am and the staff called for a taxi and even paid for the ride!

Reviews.Title: “It's Simple and Predictable”
Reviews.Author: JanJanTn
Reviews.Content: I like the predictability of Hampton Inn. Breakfast was good...cheese eggs, biscuits, cereals, oatmeal, breads/bagels, yogurts, fruit. They also offer breakfast on the go bags...nice touch. Cookies were available in the evening. The sheets on the bed were a little slimmer than other Hampton Inns that I've stayed in, but it was fine. Not the best, but fine. Service was helpful and the front desk even had menus of area restaurants. Fitness center included eliptical maches, treadmills, and a weight lifting system thing...no free weights. Pool was on top of the parking deck. Secured parking included.

Reviews.Title: “Good Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GA_Lady_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms here for a one-night pre-cruise stay at the end of August. Upon arriving at the airport, it was a bit difficult to find the area where you pick up the shuttle, as there is a sign that points you outside and then nothing--however that's because of how the Miami airport handles hotel shuttles--total chaos! You basically hail/wave-down a shuttle that belongs to your hotel, so until it gets right up on you, you really can't tell if it's the Hampton Inn Blue Lagoon, or another Hampton Inn. The shuttle driver asked us several times if we had the correct hotel shuttle and we confirmed before he would load us up. He wasn't very chatty, but it turns out that's because he doesn't speak much English, but he was nice enough to confirm that there was a Publix shopping center right across the street from the hotel. When we arrived, check in was a breeze and the young lady at the front desk was very friendly and efficient. She told us about the breakfast and signed us up for the $10 shuttle to the cruise port. The hotel is clean and secure--you have to swipe your room key before the elevator will work. One of the rooms we had was recently redone as it had a flat screen tv and the like. The other room had a regular tv, but the linens were the same as the other room. The bathroom was a typical hotel bathroom--it could use a refresh (maybe updated wallpaper), but it was clean and had all the amenties needed for a comfortable stay. On either side of the hotel are drug stores, fast food restaurants and the like. If you're cruising and want to buy plastic bottles of soda/beer/water, do go to the Publix as the nearby Walgreens and CVS do not carry plastic bottles of these items (they have cans, large bottles or sell them individually). We had breakfast at the hotel in their free breakfast bar area and it was very nice considering it was free. The coffee was good and you could take it with you in to go cups, they had sausage, egg patties (yes, you read that right) and biscuits, in addition to bagels, toast, danishes, juices, milks, cereals, etc. The manager of that area was very good at keeping things re-stocked and had a good morning for you when you walked in and a thank you for you when you left. Check out was easy and the shuttle bus driver to the cruise port was on-time and ready to help with bags. All in all, I would definately recommend this hotel, particularly for a pre- or post-cruise stay. You're very near the airport, you have a free shuttle there and back and access to food/beverage/tolietries and the like for any last minutes items you may need (like flip flops or sunscreen).

Reviews.Title: “Geat place for a pre-cruise hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Coach_Lange
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in late August. We had originally planned to stay only one night, but due to weather concerns, we came down a day early. I called the hotel while we were boarding the plan and they were very quickly able to get us in for another night. That was such a huge help as we were a bit frazzled with our last minute change in plans. We met the hotel's free van right outside the arrival's door and were quickly wisked to the hotel. We found it to be very nice - clean and comfortable, too. The front desk staff was very accomodating and quickly got us checked in. We took a quick tour of the hotel and found warm cookies in the room where they serve breakfast each morning. We then took a quick swim. For dinner, we walked cross the street. There is a strip mall there and had dinner at a great little Chinese place. From there we walked to CVS and picked up a few things we needed for our cruise. The Hamptom made our pre-cruise stay a great part of our total vacation and I would not hesitate to stay there again. I have nothing negative (really) to say about the property or the staff.

Reviews.Title: “extremely LOVELY hotel”
Reviews.Author: junepearle
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night ,as we were going on a cruise, we had a suite for 4 adults , 2 children, it was absolutely beautiful clean, VERY comfy beds, decor was modern their pool is open late, on the second floor , (outdoors,) was grand ,and a hot tub, the staff really make you feel at home, their breakfast IS continental, which is included , but its enough to get you by,the place is great i cannot say enough about it, do not hesitate to go here if your fussy like myself,

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: juju571
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on night on our way to the Bahamas. It's in a great location, 10 minutes or so from the airport but you seriously cannot hear the planes at night! I am such a light sleeper and I slept very well, the hotel was extremely quiet. We never heard any of the other guests. The front desk staff was extremely friendly, and they even upgraded us to a suite without us even asking! The room was very large and felt very clean. There was a bag of micowave popcorn for us in the kitchen, I thought that ws cool! The bed was comfy, our room had 2 tv's, and the bathroom very nice. It's right next to a shopping center with restaurants and a Walgreens and CVS. The comp breakfast was very nice, omlets, cereal, bagels, yougert, milk, juice, coffee, they even had bagged breakfasts if you had to go. Breakfast room had large flat screen with the news on. Staff here was also very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel if you need to be by the airport. There's also a free shuttle every 30 to and from the airport. Our room was only $149/night. Pretty great for Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret in Miami!”
Reviews.Author: Cruisedogs2
Reviews.Content: Our group of 6 people stayed at the Hampton Inn Blue Lagoon for 2 nights prior to a cruise. When you first drive up you think, wow this is not such a great hotel and what's all the fuss about. But, as soon as you check in you realize that it's a wonderful place! The people at the front desk go above and beyond to help with all your needs and the rooms are absolutely spotless. VERY, VERY comfortable beds and linens. The complimentary breakfast is very good with a large selection of breads, pastries, cereals (both hot and cold) and different hot items each morning. Great coffee and juice also. The hotel is very convenient to a CVS Pharmacy, Walgreens, McDonalds, a grocery store and shopping mall - all within a 2 block walk. We will definately stay here on our next trip to Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Staff”
Reviews.Author: peggyppk1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel one night before a cruise. The room and bathroom are very clean and the bed very comfortable. I booked this hotel based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and am glad I did. I made the reservation months in advance directly with the hotel and when I noticed the lower rates on their website near the travel date I called and they honored the lower price without giving me any trouble. I had called several other times regarding the shuttle to the port and the person I spoke to everytime was always helpful and polite. I did not notice any flight noises even though the location of the hotel is probably directly in the flight path. Be aware that the hotel van picks up on the departure level instead of the arrival level. If we had not called the hotel we would have been waiting forever at the wrong place! We waited about 30 min for the van but had no trouble recognizing it. Everyone at the hotel, the staff at the reception desk and breakfast room, the driver, etc. seemed happy to help. We were offered rides to nearby restaurants in the van but decided to take a walk after a 4+ hour flight from the west coast. Had a very nice dinner at the 94th Aero Squadron about a 10 min walk up the street. You can see the small planes take off out your window - no noise!! Breakfast was not gourmet Sunday brunch but adequate to kickstart the day - omelets, ham, pastries and breads, cereals, fruits, yogurt,juices coffee and teas. The shuttle to the port was on time and took about 10 min. I agree with the other reviewers that the staff at this hotel gives the impression they actually like having you there! This is probably not the place to stay for a vacation but for short Miami stops I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton-Inn as Pre-Cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: ukbyron
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights as a pre-cruise destination. The hotel transfer from the airport was quick and simple with a great driver who helped us with our luggage on to the bus. Check in was quick and efficient with great staff who told us about the local area and the bus service to the Dolphin Mall which we used the next day. The room was quiet, spotlessly clean and well equipped with free internet access and one of the most comfortable hotel beds we've ever slept in. A small shopping mall across the road has a supermarket, Italian restaurant and fast food outlets. A shuttle service operates to the port at 11am, 12pm and 1pm - we booked with reception - $10/person which was good value compared to a taxi. W saw this hotel was highly rated on Trip-Advisor and weren't disappointed. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: rcardoso
Reviews.Content: We Were at this hotel for 10 nigths . Very well located , near everything . very nice and clean rooms , comfortable bed , made every day . Very clean and modern bathroom , no nasty odors The best thing abouth this hotel is itÂ´s people , always there when you need them , very kind and useful . Theres is a small mall acrfoss rhe street with everything including a supermarket , CVS pharmacy,Walgreenes , a bank with ATM , gas station ,Office Depot , cuban , ialian and chinese food . Also nearby you cand find McDonalds,Wendys and Burger King , you choose....... Add a safe area , free gated parking well iluminated and wou will have a great place for the price

Reviews.Title: “Group stay at the Hampton pre-cruise,.”
Reviews.Author: Lvsportsnut
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent. I booked approx. 12 rooms at the Hampton Inn for my group pre-cruise. We received a great price and very comfortable accommodations. My bed was awesome and the room and hotel were clean and well-decorated. A nice surprise in the hotel was the 2nd floor dining/lounge area. The hot tub and pool are located on this floor. Additionally, there is a nice lounge area that doubles as the breakfast room. In this area, is a plasma TV with a sofa and chairs. Coffee, tea and juices are available in this area 24/7. There are several fast food restaurants close to the hotel. There is no large American food chain (i.e. Chilis, Applebees, etc.) in the area which is a downside to the hotel location. Other restaurants in the area are Cuban, Chinese and Italian restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Pre/Post Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sdlivin76
Reviews.Content: I read the review's on TA and made my descision to stay here before our cruise. The shuttle picked us up from the airport (free) and it was a quick drive to the hotel. The location was nothing touristy but it serves it's purpose. The front desk was very friendly and provided quick service. The rooms were clean and nice. My only complaint was you could hear everything. When the person in the room next to us was using a blow dryer it sounded like it was in our room. Also we were next to the elevator which was tile (not carpet like the hall ways) so every suitcase that was being wheeled over the tile was loud. The room next to us was a family with kids. The mom was yelling at the kids to the point that I knew everyone in the rooms first name. I called the front desk and within a minute heard the phone ring in the room next door and heard the women apologizing for being loud. I was happy the front desk was so quick to respond. Across the street is a strip mall with several stores and food places. We ate at a Chinese restaurant that was very good and cheap for the amount of food. In the morning we ate the free breakfast provided by the hotel which was ok food. The hotel set up a shuttle ($10 per person) to pick us up and bring us to the ship terminal. All in all I would stay again and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed in hotel, staff and area”
Reviews.Author: KEWLBEANS
Reviews.Content: This is the first time that I disagree with the previous trip reports- the staff was not helpful, the rooms were not amazing (the bed was creaky, towels smelled of that burnt, cheap hotel smell, easy t hear doord opening and closing, very noisy). The area was not very nice, there were ARMED guards everywhere-including the hotel and the grocery store (for a reason!). Breakfast was below sub standard, most of the items inedible, not fresh. We had booked last August. Requested a quiet room. We got to the room- keys did not work- the room was RIGHT next to the elevator. The receptionist was "put off' by having to change our room. It was quite comical to see how many people returned to the front desk because their keys were not working. The "key security" system in their elevators does not work well either. I'm certain that the other travelers we met while we were there will not be returning to this hotel. I know we won't. Finally- the one thing that the previous reviewers were correct about was the inconvenience of the shuttle system (not entirely the hotel's fault). If you arrive at MIA and try to catch a hotel shutte you will understand. Best to spend $10 and catch a cab to the hotel. No problems with the shuttle from the hotel to the airport (thank goodness! we could not wait to leave!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Hampton Inn and Suites Blue Lagoon”
Reviews.Author: jwlnroe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn and Suites Miami Blue Lagoon Friday March 14th for a pre cruise stay. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite as there were 6 of us. Hotel was great, room was very spacious and big, breakfast was very very good for a hot hotel breakfast. The shuttle was easy to spot at the airport.. didn't have to wait long for it to show up. Check in was smooth and easy, hotel staff was very nice and helpful. Pool wasn't heated and the hot tub was cold so didn't use either of those. . but it was a pretty windy day out on friday so it was alittle chilly with the wind. Lots to do around the hotel.. a publix grocery store, liqour store, a gas station, walgreens, cvs pharmacy, burger king, wendys, subway, a chinese and italian place. . a few shops also a steak place a few blocks away that the hotel shuttle can take you too. Very pretty area, felt safe our walking. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying pre or post cruise or even for a few days. It was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: baseballfan2008
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had never been to Miami, and when I checked on TripAdvisor, let's just say the hotels in the $150-300 range go from average down to absolutely dreadful. I spent a little more to stay at this hotel, because of the great reviews, and after seeing some of the other places I had considered, boy, am I glad I did!!! First of all, the rooms are impeccably clean, modern, and quiet. The views are not great -- we looked out at the airport, the other side of the hotel you get a worse view -- but hey, it's not South Beach, so you shouldn't expect it. Second, there is free, gated parking -- first level is covered, second level is not. A very nice pool on the second level, which we never used. Third, their breakfast spread was very good for this range of hotel. The review that I just saw of this hotel is obviously from someone not accustomed to anything other than a full-service hotel, but as someone who stays in many Hampton Inns, Fairfield Inns, etc., it was very good. I liked that they had a juice machine and apples and bananas available 24 hours a day (and occasionally there were cookies). The front desk staff was incredibly helpful and friendly -- among the best I have encountered. The area around the hotel is nothing special, but it's safe and close to the airport and Coral Gables, plus close to major highways. The choices for dining around the hotel are limited -- we ate at the Cuban restaurant in the shopping center across the street, and while the food was decent, the service was DREADFUL, and we noticed that we received MUCH, MUCH worse service than the Spanish-speaking family that entered after us. If I had it to do again, I would have eaten in the nicer-looking Italian restaurant right next door. All in all, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice newer hotel close to Miami airport”
Reviews.Author: cdntravel_lovr
Reviews.Content: I think the previous reviewers were complaining because they were expecting a luxury hotel! This Hampton Inn is not a luxury property but it is in very good, newer condition, offers a speedy shuttle service to the airport and free breakfast. It also has a nice pool area and comfortable beds with nice linens (similar to a Sheraton). It is a bit on the pricey side, but so are most of the hotels around the airport, at least the decent ones! We were pleased with our stay and would recommend it to anyone. The staff were also very pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Ok if you like travel lodge style”
Reviews.Author: Lottydog
Reviews.Content: I was expecting something much better than I got when we stayed here recently having read all these reviews. Yes the staff are helpful, yes it's very well located for the cruise port & airport & yes they transfer you free from the airport. Oh & yes they give you a 'free' breakfast. BUT it's all very average. We felt that it was vastly over priced for the basic room, no bar or restaurant and dreadful breakfast - 2 choices of hot scrambled eggs wth or without bacon bits. Lots of toast, rolls & pastries, fresh fruit plus tea & coffee. All served on plastic plates with plastic knives & forks & plastic cups. YUCK The shopping area opposite is very limited and the so called restaurants looked dodgy so we walked up the road to the Sofitel & ate there. We wished we had stayed there too.

Reviews.Title: “Overall an 8”
Reviews.Author: blooney
Reviews.Content: Hotel accommodations fit our family of 6 well. One large suite with two comfortable beds and one extremely uncomfortable pullout couch. My daughters were sloped over when I walked out in the morning and when I woke my daughters up, my 21 yr old daughter said she barely slept because her sister was ontop of her all night! I said "it's the bed!!" It was tilted. Other than that the room was fantastic. It was great having the second separate vanity area with mirror to help with four females getting ready. The pool was very nice and the whole outside patio area was great. My daughters sat outside til 2 in the morning chit-chatting and said it was great. The next morning people were having breakfast out ther. We chose to sit inside. Breakfast was ok, but I appreciated it. It came in very handy and was very helpul to us as we were headed off for our cruise. They have shuttle buses available, you just tell them and then pick a departure time, ie: 11:00, 11:30, 12:00, 12:30, etc.. $55.00 for 6 of us. They have a trailer on the back they pull for all the luggage! And we had alot!! Downside? Was not thrilled with area. Not alot of choice for dinner. Italian, Chinese and Cuban. My husband and I chose Cuban place across street and my daughters chose chinese next door. Took a long time to get food, but we loved it!!!! We were thinking we made a mistake, but we left happy. Service was poor, food made up for it. Area was so-so at night. Walgreens and CVS close, and McDonalds that we ran to and got a small lunch before we left on shuttle bus...good idea!! I thanked front desk as we were leaving on shuttle bus, THEN they thanked us. All-in-all, place worked great for us, but I still have a hard time believing this is #1 of all places listed. What are the other places like?

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ColdInMichigan
Reviews.Content: We used the Hampton Inn â€“ Blue Lagoon for our overnight stays going to and from St. Lucia. The hotel is a short ride away from the airport and located just across the street (albeit a busy one) from a strip mall that has a couple of restaurants, a liquor store and a Publix grocery store. There is also a McDonaldâ€™s, Walgreenâ€™s and CVS Pharmacy across the streets. The girl at the desk was very helpful and pleasant upon our check in. The also have 3 computers set up so you can check in online and print out boarding passes which was very nice. Our room was standard fare, nice and clean and had an extra blanket and pillow in the closet (which we used for our last minute 22 y/o tag along to use for sleeping on the floor. ï�Š) After we dumped our bags, hubby and I went across the street to the Publix and picked up some beverages and fried chicken from their deli to eat for supper as it was quite late and we just wanted to lay around. The kids decided to check out the pool and hot tub while we ran for food. In their very humble, â€˜adultâ€™ opinion (two 18 y/oâ€™s and a 22 y/o LOL) the pool was much too cold for their liking but the hot tub was clean and the temps were acceptable. I must say that the beds were VERY COMFORTABLE and there were plenty of pillows. Our wake up call came on time. We had enough time before heading to the airport to check out their breakfast items. Quite a nice selection really and everyone found stuff they wanted and had plenty. Our only complaint, if you want to call it that, is that the shuttle is VERY hard to find at the airport upon arriving. They donâ€™t have an assigned spot, so you just have to be on the look out for the van and hope he sees you flagging them down. Itâ€™s not a problem when being dropped off as they will let you out at whatever entrance/airline youâ€™re using. I would definitely recommend this place and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cct13
Reviews.Content: good clean hotel.. we stayed overnight before a cruise out of Miami Port . Rooms very clean and comfortable. entire hotel was clean . Iis located close to cvs nd walgreens and a supermarket if you need to pick up any last miniute items..They're breakfast is one of the best hotel breakfast. The hotel staff is great. Especially Harold who went above and beyond in service. The only minus I think it was a little overpriced for area and for most of the guests it was just a 1 night stopover before cruising They do have a shuttle from airport and arrange transportation to the port for $10.00 person which is a bonus

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant experience in Miami”
Reviews.Author: SanduskyTim
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 5 nights at the Miami Airport Hampton and agreed with prior reviews that this is a very pleasant place to stay. I stayed in the King Suite (#1001) and was pleased with the size of the room. It had a great view of the lagoon and Miami airport. For those of you who love to watch aircraft, you will be very happy here indeed. The windows were sound-proofed keeping it very quiet despite the busy airport nearby. The room was kept very clean. Was it perfect? No, not quite and the carpeting could use a freshening-up but ioverall, the room felt quite clean to me. The bathroom was kept spotless, I must say. The bed was much better than average. Firm and soft at the same time and without the annoying sinking, depression at the head of bed which is so common with most hotel beds. The stafff here is the best. A totally opposite attitude that one gets at S. Beach. Here, the staff actually smiles and goes out of their way to make you feel comfortable and at home. I was given directions whenever I needed them and received a great recommendation for a local barbershop, where I got a fantastic haircut. Regarding the location, it is a quick 15 minute drive to S. Beach. I have stayed at S. Beach many times and prefer this location after this visit due to the more open, less congested feel, the proximity to other destinations such as Coral Gables and most of all the friendly staff. If you are a party animal and want close access to the bars and clubs on S. Beach, this is not the place for you. If you want a relaxing, clean place to stay in this tropical location, this is a very good choice. Though this may be a slightly more expensive Hampton than other cities, this is to be expected given the very expensive Miami and S. Beach market. Overall, this represents a much better value than most properties on S. Beach. I highly recommend this place and will definitely stay here again when in Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Happy at the Hampton - Blue Lagoon”
Reviews.Author: 7MileBeach
Reviews.Content: This hotel excellent! We came to Miami specifically for a weekend of shopping and this hotel was central to all the big malls and the airport. The check-in staff were very friendly and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The breakfast was excellent too! I highly recommend this hotel specifically for shopping. I would not recommend this hotel if you want to party in South Beach which is about 20-30 min away.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: traveller5558
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. It is not that often that you can find a hotel with the level of service as high as this one, not many 5 star properties can match this. We arrived very early in the morning and without any hassle, got our room long before the official check in time. Everything is done in a very convenient and comfortable way: rooms, breakfast, lounge, swimming pool, and Internet connection. We checked in on line and printed our boarding passes from the hotelâ€™s business centre with such ease. Very friendly and helpful staff. Just to give you one of many examples. One morning we woke up late and missed breakfast. Everything had been cleared away, but when the lady noticed us, she approached us with muffins and coffee. We would like to thank you the staff of the hotel, especially Sofia, Immacula and Israel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: wolfden
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night only before embarking on our cruise. Like all reviews you will read, this hotel is exactly what you would look for to stay in before or after any flights. They pick you up at the airport and deliver you back free of charge. Unfortunately, their vans are extremely hard to spot and I had to stop two previous Hampton Inn vans before we got the Blue Lagoon van. The hotel itself was very quiet, clean and well appointed. You can see the jets taking off from your window but you can't hear a thing. The front desk staff were very professional and helped us book a shuttle to the Port of Miami the following day. They have free internet which we used and a pool which we did not. The breakfast was your standard "buffet" food. There are several eating establishments in the area as well as a small shopping plaza across the street. We would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around...and I'm finicky!”
Reviews.Author: vallelunga
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel twice in recent weeks. I live on the West Coast and needed a place to stop over and rest before getting on an international flight out of Miami. I am very selective about hotels, and was completely satisfied in every way. I'm very grateful to TripAdvisor for helping me find this hotel! PROS * Very near the airport * Shuttle runs frequently (and until midnight, without having to call) and promptly * Hotel is new and clean and well-maintained * I put a special request in my reservation...and the front desk staff actually noted it and assigned my room accordingly (surprisingly rare) * Very secure building at night -- key card needed to take elevator to guest room floors after hours * Free parking * Substantial breakfast (free) * Friendly front desk staff, housekeeping staff, and airport shuttle drivers -- I definitely got the sense they were glad I was there * Free internet access * Free fitness room * It's the little things...like the "to go" bags of breakfast food at the front desk; the newspaper being delivered to your door in a bag so you can take it with you without staining your hands or worse; the lounge area where breakfast is served is always available (and has free wifi) for you to work, socialize, etc. CONS Well, while I was at the hotel, I was formulating my TripAdvisor review in my mind. I was going to complain about the paper cups in the room. I mean, I usually stay in more upscale hotels and they always have glasses. But...i just saw a news expose at [--](entitled "Dirty Hotel Secrets") about how those glasses are never adequately cleaned in between guests, even at the best hotels. So now I am grateful to The Hampton Inn for sticking with disposables glasses! Sorry, I know it's wasteful, but I'm exposed to enough germs and viruses when I travel, I certainly don't need bugs on my hotel room glasses! Keep in mind the rooms are simple. This is a Hampton Inn after all. SUMMARY I stayed at The Hampton Inn & Suites -- Miami -- Airport South -- Blue Lagoon to break up my long international flights. I was very pleased with the place. It is as good as the TripAdvisor reviews say. As a woman traveling alone, I was grateful for all of their security measures. Will definitely stay there again if I need to be in Miami for a night or two and want to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Case1096
Reviews.Content: This was a great one night pre cruise hotel. We arrived into Miami late and booked this hotel because the free shuttle runs until 1AM. We waited about 20 minutes, our only complaint was the hotel name was hard to read on the van so just be on the lookout or you might miss it. Our room had a view of the Burger King corp HQ and the runway. Lots of fast food places as well as a Publix across the street. Hotel helped us arrange a $10 pp transfer to the pier. Free breakfast was the typical Hampton breakfast. Overall a great value.

Reviews.Title: “I will book Hampton Inn again”
Reviews.Author: HappyTrailsCanada
Reviews.Content: For an overnight stay near an airport, the hotel was great. I felt quite secure, the accommodations were nice, and the complimentary breakfast was convenient. I was also able to slip across the street to the shopping center to pick up a few things in the morning. The one area that needs improvement is the airport van shuttle. After a full day flight, it was a long, tiresome wait for the shuttle to finally arrive. One had to keep on guard, watching every vehicle that came and went to check for the right van.

Reviews.Title: “Pre Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bouff
Reviews.Content: Like so many other reviewers I booked this Hotel for aone night stay after flying in from the UK and before taking a car service up to Port Everglades to join our cruise the next day. We were lucky as the shuttle bus turned up within minutes of us exiting the terminal building. Our room was a good size, very clean and provided every amenity we required. We found all the staff to be pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was relatively good for a free Hotel breakfast in the US! The hot food wasn't too hot but there were plenty of cereals and pastries as well as fruit and yoghurt. I booked this Hotel on the strength of the reviews on this site which was once again a most reliable source of information.

Reviews.Title: “Great Post-Cruise, early flight hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladychow
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here after our cruise and for our early flight. We chose this hotel based on the review on tripadvisor and they were right on the money. We arrived at the hotel early, before noon, and they gave us a room right away. The bed was SO COMFORTABLE, especially after a week on the ship's bed, that I stayed in it the whole day to rest ... while my kids and my husband went to hang out at the pool. The room smelled so clean and was quite spacious. It was convenient as well since there are CVS, Walgreen and McDonalds within walking distance. We bought our dinner at the Pollo Tropicale which was also walking distance and really enjoyed the economical and tasty dinner. In the morning, we had to catch the 5:00 am free shuttle to the airport and figured we missed out on the free breakfast they offer, but they actually put out some grab and go breakfast bags which contained a bottle of spring water, an apple, a blueberry muffin and a special K breakfast bar - it was such a nice surprise! I recommend this hotel without reservation. We really enjoyed the rest we had here.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Pre & Post Cruise”
Reviews.Author: snickerseg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before and after our cruise. Rooms were clean and spacious. Before our cruise, we stayed on floor 8 which was good. After our cruise, our room was on the 2nd floor above the registration desk. The room was bigger but being so close to the lobby was a little noisier than I expected. We really liked the convenience of being next door to the 24 hour Walgreens allowing us to stock up on those items that are so difficult now to bring on the airplane. One other note, I found that booking through the Hampton Inn website got me the best deal and it also allowed me to register for a triple A rate and add my airline miles number for partner points.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: Lhwebbie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night prior to our cruise. The hotel offers free transportation to their facility from the Miami Airport. We had to wait about 30 minutes, but the driver arrived and was friendly and helpful. We arrived at the hotel and found it to be very clean and nice. Our room was clean and had plenty of space. The hotel suggested an Italian restaurant that was across the street and within walking distance. It was OK but nothing I would look up again. There are also two drug stores at the corner of the nearest intersection which was nice to have. I would completely agree with the others that have said the beds were very comfortable. The breakfast the next morning was very good with a nice seating area. We were able to sign up for transportation to the cruise port which was on time and reasonably priced. Overall we had a great stay and would use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Sutter
Reviews.Content: Although the prices are above those of some other airport-area hotels, I got a good rate with an AARP discount. Rooms are modern and comfortable. I had a regular room, not a suite, but it was sizable enough. There were 3 computers for customer use in the downstairs business center. Afternoon snacks available in the dining area near the pool. Included breakfast was basically okay, though the scrambled eggs were cold even though I was there soon after breakfast started at 6 a.m. There are a few basic restaurants within walking distance (I dined at a Cuban restaurant in a nearby shopping center). Parking is secure. This is the second time I have stayed here, and I would return as long as I could get a decent price. There are lots of options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the bed!”
Reviews.Author: globetrottr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites in Miami in October 2007 for 2 nights. The room was very clean. I really enjoyed the bed - it was very comfortable. The bathroom was clean, too. I also liked the shower pretty much. The WIFI worked also pretty good. All in all it was a great hotel. The breakfast buffet could be better. It was a small room. Sometimes I had to wait for a free table.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable beds EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Karma-ran-over-dogma
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotel stays I've ever had. Stayed here prior to a cruise after having travelled for almost 24 hours straight. The staff were friendly and helpful and allowed us to check in early. Free parking was nice. Yes, it is gated, but that made me feel like the car would be safe. Neighborhood wasn't bad at all. Rooms were obviously pretty new, clean and really nice. Good size too. The best thing was the amazingly comfortable beds. I don't sleep as well at home as I did there! For being SO close to the airport it was really quiet. Not much of a view of the lagoon, but that wasn't a big deal to me--it's an airport hotel. There aren't TOO many places to eat nearby--a Burger King and grocery store across the street and a few small Cuban cafes, but that's about it. Gas station with a store and pharmacy across the street were convenient as well. The hotel's complimentary breakfast is great! Hot food (sausage biscuits and gravy and eggs when I was there) as well as fruit, cereal, yogurt, pastries, many different breads/bagels/muffins, hot and cold drinks was served in a nice area with plenty of seating. I was there 30 minutes before the end of breakfast and there was still more than enough food left. They have a business center with free internet for checking e-mail and flight info. They have a small "store" on sight with snacks and necessities as well. Pool and hot tub area were a bit small, but looked nice and well kept--didn't get a chance to use it because it was raining. Would definitely stay here again if I have the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Stay AND Service”
Reviews.Author: soundgarden
Reviews.Content: I only write reviews when my hotels stays are either amazing or awful. And this stay falls under amazing. 1) Location - Right on the airport property, with, most importantly, free parking. Very convenient overall. 2) Rooms - Very clean and good sized. Great breakfast in the mornings. 3) Service - This is where the hotel shines. There was a typo in my bill, and as I submit this to my company for reimbursement, the bill needs to be 100% correct. The General Manager who worked with me on this issue went above and beyond. He returned my phone calls promptly and with enthusiasm and kindness that I can honestly say I have never witnessed before at a hotel. He even assured me that he would call Hilton Honors and make sure that the stay would post correctly on my Hilton account. I have to say that this is the best hotel that I have stayed at in Miami. I recommend this to everyone and will only stay at this hotel every time I come to Miami either on business or for fun!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: salseros2003
Reviews.Content: Very ggod stay for pre-cruise time. Perfect in all details. Just to confirm all the perfect reviews on this forum.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Blue Lagoon”
Reviews.Author: Tommo33
Reviews.Content: We got stuck in Miami for two days (american airlines lost our luggage)and luckily at the airport I rang this hotel.What a stroke of luck this place is awesome we only had the clothes we stood in but the guys on the front desk were fantastic any problem I came up with was no problem for these guys.Paid $157 plus tax for a room with two queen size beds, rooms were clean and of a good standard, the pool area was excellant and breakfast was also very good I have no negatives about this place only positives.

Reviews.Title: “Great price & location”
Reviews.Author: gs07jas
Reviews.Content: Every time I go to Miami I stay at this hotel. Great for business travelers. It has a great location just minutes from the airport and Miami beach. If you rent a car, which are very cheap in Miami, this is the place to stay...and drive around. Also, has a very cozy pool and patio. Continental breakfast is a plus and rooms are very confortables, especially the beds!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a delight!”
Reviews.Author: BirdingIsFun
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because I had an early flight and the hotel is just a few minutes from the Miami airport. What a delight it was! The front desk staff was absolutely charming. The desk clerks engaged me in a real conversation, and they both seemed genuinely interested in assisting me. The hotel itself is very modern, neat and clean. My 10th floor room had a nice city view, and the bed - oh, the Hampton bed! Sheer heaven after a long day of traveling! The Hampton rooms have so many little amenities, from the writing desk to the special pillows. The hotel has a gated parking area with locked access to the lobby - all very safe and easy - you leave your car out front while checking in, then use your card key to enter the garage to park your car, then you go straight back into the lobby from the garage to go up to your room. Unfortunately, I had to leave too early to enjoy breakfast, even though they start serving at 6 a.m. - I'm sure I would have enjoyed it! This is a great place to stay, and I heartily recommend it. It's also a terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “Details, Details, Details!! Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WeekendGetaways43
Reviews.Content: First let me say as my screen name implies, I enjoy weekend getaways when I can. I am an HHonors member as well, so I tend to frequent Hilton chain hotels... Negatives first: This is not much of a negative, actually, since this is an airport hotel. For anyone who does not know this area, it may be daunting, but this Hampton is in the heart of a very Latino area with some very good food places just a short drive away! Positives: This is the nicest Hampton I have stayed in! There is an attention to detail in the rooms that I have not seen at any other. It's amazing! I had a one bedroom suite that was absolutely spacious and is actually set up for long term stays with a 2 burner stove top, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, full sized fridge and all the utensils necessary ( including dish washing liquid and paper towels...again, details) The room was spotless and clean! The staff, from the front desk to the buffet hostesses to housekeeping must have taken a Disney course in etiquette because they are excellent! The pool(dawn to dusk) area is on the second floor as is the fitness room(6am to midnight) and the breakfast area ( with a large plasma TV for the AM news... again, details). One glitch during our stay was the Hot Tub was not working, but no worries there, since the pool area was just fine. Parking is on the first and second floor and requires a room key for entry into the gated garage. The first floor is covered, the second is not. We didn't use it, but there was an airport shuttle schedule posted at the front desk area. There is a convenience store (next to the front desk) with various snack foods and microwaveable items and of course, ice cream for the midnight munchies. On the first floor is also the business center with 3 computers. Of course as with other Hamptons is the complimentary Wireless Internet. Across the street is a Publix for grocery shopping and a 24 hour CVS drug store. For the fast food junkies, Wendy's, McDonald's and Pollo Tropical is a block or two away. 94th Aero Squadron is a good restaurant if you are looking for Prime Rib, but with its central proximity, this hotel is close to the fine dining of Coral Gables(15-20min drive south on 57 avenue - depending on the time of day). For an open air Latin experience, and I do mean open air kind of roughing it, the Palacios de Jugos is south on 57 ave and West Flagler. The specialty is chicharonnes( fried pork) and tamals as well as fresh fruits and juices. Beware, this is no way fancy, but you get a bit of the Miami, Latin flavor the way the locals experience unlike the South Beach experience which is definitely not the Real Miami. OK, to finish up the hotel review.. There is also Lodge Net for in-room movies and also free HBO with 27 inch TV's ( 2 in the suite)... And of course, here we go again, as in my other reviews, "The Bed".. very comfortable... Yep it's a Hampton and then some! FYI, I have stayed at the airport Hilton( Super Bowl Headquarters for the Chicago Bears) about a half mile away. This place is way better in my eyes for the quick overnight(regular room) or long-term stay( suite), from an overall value and cleanliness standpoint. If you are looking for full service (room service and restaurants), then this isn't it, but it is understandable how this Hampton beats all the other full-service hotels on Trip Advisor. Details...Details... Details

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Iridescentkittie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night after we returned from a cruise. Overall it was a great experience! To my knowledge, it is not near anything remotely touristy, so don't stay here if you plan to sight-see. We chose this hotel for its proximity to the airport, to make our journey home less complicated. We made a good choice! A complimentary airport shuttle leaves the lobby every half-hour on the nose. The front desk staff were very friendly and very accomodating. Check-in time is 3:00 PM, but they let us into our room at 10:30 AM when we arrived exhausted from a week of cruising! The surrounding area is typical for an airport hotel. There are some 24-hour drugstores, a grocery store, many fast food places and a few sit-down restaurants. Like most other Tripadvisor users reported, the front desk highly recommended Casa Juan, a nearby Cuban restaurant. We promptly avoided it after reading what others have had to say about it! There is heavy vehicle traffic but not a lot of pedestrian traffic - I felt quite safe, actually. The hotel requires you to swipe your room key in the elevator to access any guestroom floors - also a nice safety feature. The free breakfast features a mix of hot and cold items - above avearge for a free hotel breakfast, in my opinion. Our room was very nice - the bed was extremely comfortable, the room and bathroom were clean and spacious, and even though we could see planes landing and taking off outside our window, we heard absolutely no outside noise while trying to sleep. While we didn't get a chance to use it, there is an outdoor pool and hot tub area that looked quite inviting. I highly recommend this hotel - I can see why it is ranked #1 in its area!

Reviews.Title: “when she was good she was very good but when she was bad......”
Reviews.Author: sbccc
Reviews.Content: This is a basic Hampton Inn. The outside is ugly and the area around it is a little run down. The hotel itself is nice enough and well maintained. The staff are very outgoing and helpful. The breakfast is pretty average. Overall it is a decent place to stay if you just want a bed for the night. The staff will recommend a Cuban restaurant across the street - don't eat there.

Reviews.Title: “Great pre-cruise hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steeler_Pens_fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn & Suites - Miami Airport / Blue Lagoon the night before a recent cruise we took departing from the Port of Miami. The hotel was great in all aspects from the free shuttle service from the airport, the friendly check-in, the clean & well appointed room, to the great free breakfast. We highly recommend this hotel and especially to anyone looking for a hotel to stay prior to a cruise. While the hotel does not provide transportion to the Port it is easy to arrange for a taxi or limo (In our case we made arrangements with Limos of Miami, but that is a different review.). Why be stressed worrying about flights the day of your cruise, when you can fly in the day before or even earlier and enjoy the Hampton Inn & Suites - Miami Airport / Blue Lagoon.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and value”
Reviews.Author: travelmates4fun
Reviews.Content: Not sure what dumpster diver is talking about. This place was great!!! I stayed there with my family before catching a cruise and we practically loved everything about it and for a good rate too. The front desk was very helpful. They recommended a great restaurant nearby that was perfect for my kids (and provided a free shuttle) where we could watch the planes take off and land and my son could listen to the control tower - how cool is that! Breakfast was wonderful and FREE - hot items and they even had a variety of yogurts for my wife. My kids loved mixing the different cold cereals together - they can't do that at home. We are planning another cruise in the fall and will definately stay here again. I highly recommend this hotel for people who need to be near the airport or going on a cruise.

Reviews.Title: “good for a first night after a long haul flight”
Reviews.Author: creaseym
Reviews.Content: We flew in from the UK and after a 9 hour flight plus delays, were very glad we chose somewhere as convenient as this. The hotel is very clean throughout and has free secure parking, free internet, complimentary beverages 24hrs, and free breakfast. The beds were as comfortable as we like and although the hotel is near the airport (about 3 miles) there was no aircraft noise, or indeed any noise in our room. Breakfast available from 6am was also very welcome while we were getting used to the time difference. We stayed 2 nights before setting off on a grand tour of the Keys and Everglades. On the second day they didn't make up our room until about 4.30 pm, and as we were still tired, we would have liked to have gone back to bed for a nap before then. So that was a bit inconvenient, but I'm sure if we had asked for the room to be made up earlier they would have done it, so can't really be critical about that. All in all, just what we wanted and a good first stop.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK, can be pricey- no late check out”
Reviews.Author: mycrtrip
Reviews.Content: Used to like this place better, but I have some comments now: the good * location, close to airport and has a shuttle * rooms and beds are comfortable * staff is quite friendly the bad * breakfast is quite poor, supposedly 'free' but the hotel rate can go up to $ 270 for a suite so I don't feel it is free at all. * we asked to have check out extended for just an hour or two because we had a late flight but were allowed just one hour, (1 pm) during which the maid knocked on our door four times *we asked for a non smoking room but were given a smoking room, which is terrible taking into account the rooms have no ventilation so the nicotine gets to you in general the hotel is ok but lately their rates are quite high as they keep their service to the bare minimum.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you're in transit”
Reviews.Author: HunterDrayman
Reviews.Content: If you're flying in or out of Miami Intl. this is an ideal place to stay, especially if you arrive late at night or depart early. The rooms are well appointed and quiet, and the staff are informal, helpful and friendly. We stayed twice - on arrival we had a standard room and on leaving the USA we got a walk-in booking on the day - A suite for only $30 more!. The breakfast was good if you like fruit, cereals, juices, pastries and coffee and there were a few basic hot choices too. Sadly you have to use polystyrene cups and plates and 'snappery' instead of real cutlery. I noticed they have 'to-go' bags if you're in a hurry or have to leave outside normal breakfast hours. Free coffee was available all day and even some fruit and snacks in the afternoon. There's a small pool and jacuzzi. We didn't try these as it was dark on our first stay and very windy on the second.
