But they looked inviting and had the usual facilities. Car parking was free and convenient if you can negotiate a steep ramp. There's a plaza with supermarket, restaurants and other shops right next to the hotel and you should be able to find pretty much everything you may need there unless you want fine dining. The Cuban restaurant was OK for us. Driving in from the west on route 41 the hotel was nice and easy to locate, which is good if you are nervous about driving in Miami. We had some trouble getting to the hotel from the airport as we arrived at half past midnight. There's a shuttle that operates until 1am, but when we phoned at about 00:45 the last one had gone. Instead, reception told us to get a yellow or blue cab and the hotel would pay up to $14 of the fare (given a receipt). What they didn't say was that yellow and blue cabs have different charging structures and that yellows won't look at you for such a short journey (its less that a mile). Blue cabs were thin on the ground, but when the guy directing traffic outside arrivals saw me causing chaos by flitting from cab to cab he got on his radio and a blue cab arrived precisely where he said it would about 3 mins later. Blue cabs have zones and The Hampton is in zone 1 - $14 fare. If you arrive when the shuttle is operating be aware that you have to go to the departures area to board it. I noticed many reports here telling of difficulty attracting the driver's attention at arrivals. In fact, the airport authorities don't allow the shuttle to stop at arrivals - only departures. Advice on this is hidden away on the Hampton's website along with pictures to help you identify the right shuttle bus. Its good to see that the manager monitors the Tripadvisor reviews and notes what guests have to say.

Reviews.Title: “Great Employees!!”
Reviews.Author: fishgirl917
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at this Hampton lnn location. The employees were extremely helpful, and very polite and friendly. Whenever we had a question they were very happy to accomodate us. The room was your typical Hampton Inn room comfortable bed, plenty of towels etc. Great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Travelers...Please read and BEWARE!!”
Reviews.Author: amy5467
Reviews.Content: Under any other circumstance I would say this is a fine hotel and would give it a glowing review but if you stay here you better check your credit card statement a few days afterward as I have good reason to believe that some criminal element is working at this hotel. My family stayed one night at this hotel on Easter weekend and it was the only charge on my particular credit card. Two days after checking out over $400 in fradulent charges for international calling cards and cell phones was charged to my card. It doesn't take a rocket scientist to figure out that when that is the only charge on your card that you've made that the others are fraudulent. Yes this is indeed a nice hotel but I'm just giving everyone out there a heads up. I've contacted the hotel's manager and am going to contact Hilton hotels corporate office as I'm sure I'm not the only one this has happened to. I'm just lucky that I could pinpoint how it happened.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: fueyo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here pre-cruise. Very friendly hotel staff, clean rooms, restaurants and pharmacy in walking distance. Cuban restaurant across the street is good place to eat. Seems like a safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Property and staff”
Reviews.Author: hanklem
Reviews.Content: Recently I stayed two nights at the Hampton Inn & Suites Miami Airport South, Blue Lagoon. I was very impressed with this location. The management team is running a really fine property there. Most of the time I stay in Hilton Garden Inns, Doubletrees or Embassy Suites, so I am accustomed to a slightly higher amenity level than the Hamptons. But I have to say -- because I tell everyone this -- Hampton Inn is the best value in the hotel market today. Hands down, no question. And this property is an excellent example of why. - Parking was great - Check-in was great, extremely competent and very friendly - The room exceeded my expectation (I stayed in 206). The bathroom, in particular, was surprisingly large and well appointed for a Hampton Inn - The bed was, wow, terrific. Granted I had a fever and was completely worn out when I arrived, but it was a great bed under any conditions. - The Internet connection was terrific (though I generally prefer hard-wired) - Breakfast was fine (with my fever, I especially appreciated that one could use the juice machine outside breakfast hours) - As I did not have my travel bag (lost by the airline) the staff provided me with a toiletries kit that was great - the staff were all friendly and helpful This particular property nailed its mission and my expectations that I had to write a review.

Reviews.Title: “Great End to the Holiday”
Reviews.Author: The_Lewis
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to pigeonhole this hotel. It is what it proclaims to be - a Hampton Inn. It was clean, spacious, included breakfast and had free high speed internet. That would get it a 3 star rating. However, as others have noted, the staff was very efficient and friendly. For whatever reason, that just made the whole experience feel very good. We had a great night's sleep and the hotel arranged a taxi in the morning when the shuttle was oversubscribed. So that earns a 4 star rating. We didn't get a great deal on the room - US$280, but it was March Break and not a lot of choice in Miami. From our Miami hotel experiences, you need to spend in Miami to get anything decent. I would highly recommend this hotel to all travellers who need to get on a plane or on a cruise. We'll return again.

Reviews.Title: “CHARACTERLESS AND EFFICIENT”
Reviews.Author: UKPeripatetic
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn is a characterless but efficient many-storied hotel near Miami Airport with its own shuttle bus connection. Our room was blandly-decorated with sealed windows and typical suburban view over Wendy's, CVS and Macdonalds. I have nothing to complain about (except the cost), but nothing to get excited about either. It's the sort of place where people spend one satisfactory night before or after a flight and can't remember anything about the hotel when they get home. It's not what I think of as a Hampton Inn (usually stylish and the best in their market); it's an average airport hotel with a Hampton name stuck on. And at $240 for a room, it's not cheap. Or was I swindled?

Reviews.Title: “perfect for pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: mossclan
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect hotel for a pre or post-cruise stay. Juan at the front desk (while a little hard to understand over the phone) is very helpful and friendly. The shuttle service from the airport was very efficient. The front desk staff also can arrange shuttle service to the Port of Miami for a reasonable fee. The hotel was clean and the breakfast was nice.

Reviews.Title: “A Proud Staff”
Reviews.Author: adanacsim
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay in the Miami area so that we could head up north the next day without hitting city traffic and this hotel filled the bill. The endorsement by Trip Advisor reviewers was also important. When we checked in, we were reminded immediately by the desk clerks about this hotel's #1 Miami rating on Trip Advisor. They were not being arrogant -- they seemed genuinely pleased and determined to satisfy the cutomer, something that other hotel staffs could do more of. As another reviewer has noted, it's hard to imagine that this hotel is anything like the best in the Miami area; however, we give them high marks for doing what they do very well. Our primary objective was to get a restful night's sleep and we achieved that in our room, which was large, comfortable (especially the bed) and very quiet (being near an airport and in a room with adjoining door on a low floor usually doesn't portend well, but we didn't hear any traffic, airplane or neighbor noise at all). Self-parking was available -- ample, free and safe. No view, no robes, no luxury, but we didn't expect any of that. We didn't find the breakfast as great as others have, but, once again, the effort was obvious. The only real negative we have to report was the recommendation by the desk clerk that we eat at Casa Juancho, which was a dismal experience. The hotel was not bargain-priced, but considering Trip advisor reviews of hotels in this price range elsewhere in Miami, this did seem to be a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: sgparker
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price! Recieved a real good price with my husbands bcaaa membership. Got to the hotel at 9:00 am after flying all night . They said our room wasn't ready yet but to go up and have the comp breakfast that they serve everyday which is huge and isn't your usual hotel freebee breakfast. there was hot as well as cold things to eat. Room was awesome. King size fluffy comforter lots of pillows didn't want to leave bed. Pool and surrounding area is also clean and well kept. Area hotel is in isn't that bad theres a Wallgreans, Publex grocery store , Burger king, ect... Staff is awesome most helpful. We stayed there one night pre-cruise there's a shuttle that picks you up at the airport for free when you arrive and they can arrange a shuttle to pick you up to take you to the cruise port for $10.00 per person. way more than a taxi. hotel is near the airport but never heard one plane unless outside by the pool. Will recommend this hotel to anyone that asks.

Reviews.Title: “#1 hotel--no way, averge at best”
Reviews.Author: texex91
Reviews.Content: For $200/night I cannot believe what you get. You get a standard Hampton room (and an old one at that). Nothing special and not in a great area at all. As Diamond I had to ask for upgrade. Service was okay, but for the price you have got to be kidding. Average to old room and bad neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “The H in Hampton Stands for Helpful”
Reviews.Author: Travelin'_Florida
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at Hampton Inns every week on business because we know that we will have a comfortable room and a good hot breakfast for me and a breakfast bag for him on his way to the office. I had quite a bit to carry up on our breakfast tray on Sunday and I was helped by one of the employees by carrying the extra tray up to our room. This definitely was one of the best Hampton's that we have stayed at in the whole state! The pool area is beautiful and very spacious and there was a great winding staircase going up to the second floor. They have secure elevators that allow only guests to go up to the rooms. Check-in was quick and efficient; we arrived before check-in time and our room wasn't ready yet, but they had our requested room near the elevator ready in no time because we are members of Hilton Honors Program. It is definitely worth joining even if you are an in-frequent traveler with points to earn free stays and special treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: GatorDocs
Reviews.Content: We got a suite with a mini-kitchen and it was wonderful. It was very clean and was well stocked with dishes, pots & pans, tupperware, and silverware. The staff is very helpful - the desk staff and the cleaning staff. The cleaning staff was excellent. The breakfast is great - much more extensive than at cheaper hotels. We decided to not use the hot tub - it didn't look very clean. However, the pool was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: morseman21
Reviews.Content: My family and I got stuck up a creek because the "Days Inn Miami Airport" screwed up our reservations and gave our room away; they're idiots over there trust me. The Hampton in however was probably one of the nicest hotel rooms I think I have ever stayed in. The hotel itself was spectacular and extremely clean. My favorite part was the breakfast it was so much better than any of the hotels I have stayed at recently. The staff was extremely friendly and well spoken; it has been my experience that most places in Miami people don't even speak English but they sure did here! We were traveling with my 2 year old son and we asked for a crib at check in and by the time we got to our room the crib was already there and setup; my son slept very well so I assume it was just as comfy as our nice big fluffy bed. The location is great too, you have a CVS, Walgreenâ€™s, Publix, Burger King and a nice Chinese restaurant all within a 2 minute walk; it's literally right across the street, just be careful and use the crosswalks. The airport shuttle was very quick and efficient and during our stay we never heard any sounds from the airport, the room was perfectly silent. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable awesome group coordinator & staff”
Reviews.Author: lizstas
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 25 and decided on this hotel based on the reviews from TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. The group coordinator of this hotel continually went above and beyond to ensure our stay was more than Satisfactory. The hotel does offer free shuttle from the airport. Due to our group size Lourdes arranged for airport pickup for everyone (nominal fee pp). The drivers were waiting with newer/clean vans & trailer for luggage. We were taken to the hotel and after checkin our prearranged transportation took us over to Bayside & some of the group to South Beach. When we wanted to stay longer we called the driver and he said NO PROBLEM. They picked us up where and when they said they would. The next morning the drivers were again waiting to shuttle us to the port. All transportation was arranged through the hotel group coordinator (fees were reasonable). She suggested destinations, amount of time needed, etc. On our return to the port we did not have transportation booked we were considering ship based excursions. I emailed Hampton Inn from the ship and the Group Coordinator arranged for pickup--keep in mind that we were not staying at the hotel on our return--We were going home. She could not reach me by phone to confirm we worked via email. I called the driver when we reached Miami at 6am and he said Lourdes was unsure of the time but he'd be waiting with a group sign at the pier around 7am. Our group was split up getting off the ship and it delayed them over 40 minutes but they waited to take us all to the airport as a group. When we arrived at the airport the Group Coordinator of Hampton Inn (Lourdes) had called me--she wanted to see if our trip was satisfactory and if the driver picked us up as promised. Keep in mind this was a Sunday Morning and she works Monday-Friday. When we checked in the hotel on Saturday (her off day)--she also called me at the hotel checking to see if everything was satisfactory upon check in. We've stayed in Miami before and did not care for the hotel, staff or location. At the Wyndham during our last stay we were told by the bus driver not to go out at night the area is too dangerous--needless to say we didn't enjoy Miami or feel safe. We didn't feel uncomfortable at this hotel at all--great security--you must have an active hotel key in order to take the elevator in this hotel. Clean, reliable arranged transportation allowed us to enjoy the sights of Miami. Again, rooms are clean and comfortable---it's not the Ritz--it's an affordable and clean hotel with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for precruise”
Reviews.Author: lagwagon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, We arrived on an early flight and tho our rooms were not ready, we were able to sit by the pool. We had missed the breakfast, but an employee was kind enough to get my daughter and me "breakfasts to go" Hotel staff was very helpful in getting us into our rooms by noon. Very clean, wonderful beds, pillows, and comfortors! Great location-across the street is a Walgreens, wendys, bakery, and a little market. Would definately stay here again! Price w/AAA was great, too. Also there was a shuttle to the port for $10/person

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Great to use when taking a cruise from Port of Miami”
Reviews.Author: Sailguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this location about 6 years ago before taking our first cruise--the hotel had just opened. I'm happy to say--6 years later it's still a great buy. We stayed there before and after our recent cruise after Thanksgiving and were thoroughly pleased. It's about 5 minutes from the Miami airport and has a free shuttle, nice complimentary breakfast, great pool, hot tub and exercise room. Staff are courteous, rooms are clean, bed was great and the hotel gives a nice overall impression. The area it's in has the basics--fast food in walking distance, drug stores, market, etc. for any items you might have forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: cadybugtours
Reviews.Content: After all of the great reviews of this hotel, I was expecting more. It's an ok hotel. The bed was nice and the room was average. I didn't think it deserved the glowing reviews. No room service is available. Please note that it is under construction at this time. Had I known that, I would have taken my $169 somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “great choice”
Reviews.Author: andrew340
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel pre and post cruise. Hotel in good condition and very clean. Stayed in the one bedroom suite. The Hampton bed was very comfortable. Hampton breakfast also good. On return from cruise, the hotel let us check into our room at 10:15 am - very impressed with that. Overall excellent value and will use the hotel on future stays in the Miami Airport area.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stopover but it's not a resort hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alliebdive
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after arriving from London. It was great to stay somewhere so near the airport and not have to deal with picking up the car and driving on while we were tired. The reception staff were very welcoming and our one bedroomed suite was extremely spacious and contained everything you could want - perfect for our party of 2 adults and 2 teens. Contrary to some other reports, I thought the breakfast was much better than I'd expected - it is certainly much better than other "free" breakfasts we have been offered. There was plenty of hot food as well as cold selections and a good selection of breads and pastries. It isn't a luxury hotel - it's a Hampton Inn. Don't expect it to be suitable for your vacation! It's not a resort. We paid around $220 for a night which is a lot of money for what is essentially a budget range of hotels. Having said that, Miami is expensive, the location was great and the free shuttle etc very convenient. We would definitely stay here again under similar circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: hliss
Reviews.Content: Given the stellar reviews, I guess I was expecting more. It is decent for a Hampton Inn, but it is still a Hampton Inn. Beds were comfortable, but the room, and the breakfast room had some serious air conditioning problems. Our room never cooled, but given that we checked in after midnight we did not bother to report the problem. When we got to the breakfast room, it was a similar problem. When I mentioned that the room and breakfast room were hot, I assumed they would indicate that this was a temporary problem. They denied that there were any problems with the hotel, which suggests to me that this is the way the hotel normally is. Yuck! Although it is nice that they provide a breakfast, especially the breakfast on the go, and staff were nice, it was still a motel breakfast. Eggs seemed powdery, biscuits were hard, watery gravy, unripe fruit, bread and bagels, and cereals. And the price was quite a bit higher than the typical Hampton Inn. I would not return to this hotel.
